                                                 ###




                                                ­ 14 ­ 
  Illinois Department of Financial and 
  Professional Regulation 
  Division of Professional Regulation                                 NEWS
SPRINGFIELD ­ The Illinois Department of Financial and Professional Regulation (IDFPR) 
announced today that Directors of Professional Regulation, Daniel E. Bluthardt; Financial 
Institutions, Robert Meza; Insurance Michael T. McRaith, and Banking, Jorge A. Solis signed the 
following disciplinary orders in the month of December 2008. 



                                                Banks 
                                BANKS AND TRUST COMPANIES 

       Corn Belt Bank and Trust Company, Pittsfield – ordered to cease and desist from 
engaging in unsafe and unsound banking practices. 

       Strategic Capital Bank, Champaign – amended order to cease and desist from engaging in 
unsafe and unsound banking practices. 

      West Suburban Bank, Lombard – ordered to cease and desist from engaging in unsafe and 
unsound banking practices. 


                                    Financial Institutions 

                                       CONSUMER CREDIT 

        The Payday Loan Store of Illinois, Inc., Aurora ­ CILA license (1695) fined $5,300 for the 
following  violations:  the  payment  receipt  does  not  accurately  show  the  required  elements,  the 
payment record for a simple interest loan does not show the principal balance due, the date to which 
interest is paid or itemize other charges collected, repossession file does not indicate a statement of 
final accounting containing the required information was sent to the borrower, and borrower’s name 
is not present on the contract. 

         The Payday Loan Store of Illinois, Inc., Burbank ­ CILA license (1529) fined $4,650 for 
failure to accurately show the required elements on the payment receipt. 



                                                  ­ 1 ­ 
          The Payday Loan Store of Illinois, Inc., Waukegan ­ CILA license (2921) fined $4,500 for 
the following violations: recording fee or closing cost is collected but not paid, the annual percentage 
rate  is  not  accurately  disclosed,  the  file  of  original  papers  for  the  loan  is  not  properly  maintained, 
improper  simple  interest  calculation,  security  is  not  properly  disclosed,  and  repossession  file  does 
not  indicate  a  statement  of  final  accounting  containing  the  required  information  was  sent  to  the 
borrower.

         The Payday Loan Store of Illinois, Inc., Broadview ­ CILA license (1532) fined $4,000 for 
failure to contain evidence of a contract signed or acknowledged by the borrower in the file. 

          The Payday Loan Store of Illinois, Inc., Waukegan ­ CILA license (2549) fined $3,400 for 
the following violations: recording fee or closing cost is collected but not paid, the annual percentage 
rate  is  not  accurately  disclosed,  improper  simple  interest  calculations,  repossession  file  does  not 
indicate  a  statement  of  final  accounting  containing  the  required  information  was  sent  to  the 
borrower.

        The Payday Loan Store of Illinois, Inc., Aurora ­ CILA license (1394) fined $3,250 for the 
following violations:  recording fee or closing cost is collected but not paid, improper simple interest 
calculation, and payment history of the repossession account does not properly identify the proceeds 
from the sale of collateral,  file does not contain evidence of a contract singed or acknowledged  by 
the borrower. 

      The  Payday  Loan  Store  of  Illinois,  Inc.,  Aurora  ­  CILA  license  (2885)  fined  $3,000  for 
improper simple interest calculation. 

       The Payday Loan Store of Illinois, Inc., Aurora ­ CILA license (1394) fined $2,600 for the 
following violations:  recording fee or closing cost is collected but not paid and file does not contain 
evidence of a contract signed or acknowledged by the borrower. 

        The Payday Loan Store of Illinois, Inc., Bellwood ­ CILA license (2181) fined $1,950 for 
the following violations:  improper simple interest calculation, licensee did not deliver or mail to the 
borrower an affidavit of defense, licensee did not give written notice of intended sale/disposition of 
repossessed  collateral  including  all  required  information,  payment  history  of  the  repossession 
account does not properly identify the proceeds from the sale of collateral, repossession file does not 
contain  signed  receipts  showing  the  collateral  purchased,  the  amount  paid  and  the  name  of  the 
obligor, repossession  file  does  not  indicate  a  statement  of  final  accounting  containing  the  required 
information  was  sent  to  the  borrower,  the  licensee  did  not  have  receipts  to  document  charges  in 
connection  with  the  sale  of  collateral,  and  file  does  not  contain  evidence  of  a  contract  singed  or 
acknowledged by the borrower. 

        The Payday Loan Store of Illinois, Inc., Elgin ­ CILA license (2928) fined $1,650 for the 
following violations: the annual percentage rate is not accurately disclosed, improper simple interest 
calculations, licensee did not deliver or mail to the borrower an affidavit of defense, licensee did not 
give  written  notice  of  intended  sale/disposition  of  repossessed  collateral  including  all  required 
information,  payment  history  of  the  repossession  account  does  not  properly  identify  the  proceeds 
from the sale of collateral, repossession file does not contain signed receipts showing the collateral 
purchased,  the  amount  paid  and  the  name  of  the  obligor,  and  repossession  file  does  not  indicate  a 
statement of final accounting containing the required information was sent to the borrower.



                                                        ­ 2 ­ 
       The Payday Loan Store of Illinois, Inc., Elgin ­ CILA license (2816) fined $1,550 for the 
following  violations:  improper  simple  interest  calculations,  repossession  file  does  not  indicate  a 
statement of final accounting containing the required information was sent to the borrower, and file 
does not contain evidence of a contract signed or acknowledged by borrower. 

         The Payday Loan Store of Illinois, Inc., Dolton ­ CILA license (2883) fined $1,550 for the 
following  violations: recording  fee or closing cost is collected  but not paid, the  loan contract does 
not accurately disclose the schedule of payments, repossession file does not indicate a statement of 
final  accounting  containing  the  required  information  was  sent  to  the  borrower,  and  file  does  not 
contain evidence of a contract signed or acknowledged by the borrower. 

       The Payday Loan Store of Illinois, Inc., Hanover Park ­ CILA license (2817) fined $1,500 
for improper simple interest calculations. 

        The Payday Loan Store of Illinois, Inc., Aurora ­ CILA license (2885) fined $1,300 for the 
following violations: improper simple interest calculation, security is not properly disclosed, licensee 
did  not  deliver  or  mail  to the  borrower  an  affidavit  of  defense,  date  of  repossession  not  available, 
licensee  did  not  give  written  notice  of  intended  sale/disposition  of  reposed  collateral  including  all 
required  information,  and  repossession  file  does  not  indicate  a  statement  of  final  accounting 
containing the required information was sent to borrower. 

        The Payday Loan Store of Illinois, Inc., Chicago ­ CILA license (2785) fined $1,150  for 
the following violations: file does not contain evidence of a contract signed or acknowledged by the 
borrower and wage assignment was accepted from borrower that contained blank spaces. 

        The Payday Loan Store of Illinois, Inc., Calumet City ­ CILA license (2455) fined $1,100 
for the following violations:  recording  fee or closing cost is collected but not paid, security is not 
properly disclosed, repossession file does not indicate a statement of final accounting containing the 
required information was sent to the borrower, and security in not released. 

        The Payday Loan Store of Illinois, Inc., Elgin ­ CILA license (2816) fined $1,050 for the 
following  violations:  improper  simple  interest  calculations,  payment  history  of  the  repossession 
account does not properly identify the proceeds from the sale of collateral, repossession file does not 
contain signed receipts showing the collateral purchased, the amount paid and the name of obligor, 
repossession  file  does  not  indicate  a  statement  of  final  accounting  containing  the  required 
information was sent to the borrower, repossession file does not contain a copy of the condition of 
collateral  at  time  of  repossession,  and  the  licensee  did  not  have  receipts  of  document  charges  in 
connection with the sale of collateral. 

       The  Payday  Loan  Store  of  Illinois,  Inc.,  Chicago  Heights  ­  CILA  license  (1446)  fined 
$1,050 for failure to properly disclose security. 

        The  Payday  Loan  Store  of  Illinois,  Inc.,  South  Holland  ­  CILA  license  (2079)  fined 
$1,000 for the following violations:  payment history of the repossession account does not properly 
identify  the  proceeds  from  the  sale  of  the  collateral,  repossession  file  does  not  contain  signed 
receipts  showing  the  collateral  purchased,  the  amount  paid  and  the  name  of  the  obligor,  and 
repossession  file  does  not  indicate  a  statement  of  final  accounting  containing  the  required 
information was sent to the borrower. 

      The Payday Loan Store of Illinois, Inc., Chicago ­ CILA license (1395) fined $1,000  for 
improper simple interest calculation.
                                           ­ 3 ­ 
                                             PAYDAY LOANS 

         The Payday Loan Store of Illinois, Inc., Calumet City ­ PLRA license (1312) fined $8,100 
for the following violations:  lender did not enter into the database that the borrower’s loan was paid 
in full or cancelled on the day the transaction was made, the lender made a payday loan but there is 
no  evidence  of  a  signed,  written  agreement,  loans  over  25% of  borrower’s  income,  lender  made  a 
payday loan resulting in the borrower having a combined outstanding payday loan principal balance 
greater than 25% of borrower’s gross monthly income, and security is not released. 

         The Payday  Loan Store of Illinois, Inc., Waukegan ­ PLRA license (1313)  fined $4,800 
for  the  following  violations:  lender  did  not  obtain  any  official  documentation  of  the  borrower’s 
income before making a payday loan, loans over 25% of borrower’s income, Lender made a payday 
loan resulting in the borrower having a combined outstanding payday loan principal balance greater 
than the 25% of borrower’s gross monthly income, a partial payment on a PLRA loan or repayment 
plan  was  not  entered  into  the  database  on  the  date  the  transaction  was  made,  and  official  income 
documentation  was  not the required type  for a payday  loan or was  not for  income  for the 30 days 
preceding the loan. 

        The Payday Loan Store of Illinois, Inc., Plano ­ PLRA license (1332) fined $3,100 for the 
following violations: lender did not enter into database that the borrower’s loan was paid in full or 
cancelled on the day the transaction was made, payday lender did not provide the required notice of 
the consumer’s right to a repayment plan in a separate signed written document, loans over 25% of 
borrower’s  income,  lender  made  a  payday  loan  resulting  in  the  borrower  having  a  combined 
outstanding  payday  loan  principal  balance  greater  than  25%  of  borrower’s  gross  monthly  income, 
lender  did  not  properly  enter  the  payday  loan  repayment  plan  into  the  database  on  the  day  it  was 
executed, official income documentation was not the required type for a payday loan or was not for 
income for the 30 days preceding the loan, and security is not released. 

       The  Payday  Loan  Store  of  Illinois,  Inc.,  Chicago  Heights  ­  PLRA  license  (1299)  fined 
$2,250 for the  following  violations:  lender did  not enter into the database that the borrower’s  loan 
was paid in full or cancelled on the day the transaction was made, payday lender did not provide the 
required notice of the consumer’s right to a repayment plan in a separate signed written document, 
and a deposited check or ACH debit request on a PLRA loan was not entered into the database on 
the deposit or request date. 

        The Payday  Loan Store of Illinois, Inc., Waukegan ­ PLRA license (1313)  fined $2,100 
for failure to enter into database that the borrower’s loan was paid in full or cancelled on the day the 
transaction was made. 

        The Payday Loan Store of Illinois, Inc., Burbank ­ PLRA license (1306) fined $2,000 for

acknowledged by the borrower.

                                  ROOFING CONTRACTORS

       James A. Godfrey, Godfrey Roofing, South Elgin – roofing contractor license (104­ 
014389) and qualifying party roofing contractor license (105­000007) ordered to cease and desist

                                                ###




                                               ­ 11 ­ 
  Illinois Department of Financial and
  Professional Regulation
  Division of Professional Regulation                             NEWS
SPRINGFIELD - The Illinois Department of Financial and Professional Regulation (IDFPR)
announced today that Directors of Professional Regulation, Daniel E. Bluthardt; Financial
Institutions, Robert Meza; Insurance, Michael T. McRaith, and Banking, Jorge A. Solis signed the
following disciplinary orders in the month of January 2009.



                                             Banks
                              BANKS AND TRUST COMPANIES

       Mutual Bank, Harvey – ordered to cease and desist from engaging in unsafe and unsound
banking practices effective 1/9/09.


                                         PAWNSHOPS

       Eric’s Fast Cash, Bloomington – application for licensure denied effective 1/21/09.

                                    Financial Institutions

                                       CONSUMER CREDIT

        QC Financial Services, Inc., Waukegan - PLRA license (1265) fined $43,650 for the
following violations: lender did not verify that the loan was permissible, lender did not enter into the
database that the borrower’s loan was paid in full or cancelled on the day the transaction was made,
lender made a payday loan that resulted in the borrower having outstanding payday loan(s) more
than 45 consecutive days, loans over 25% of borrower’s income, lender made a payday loan
resulting in the borrower having a combined outstanding payday loan principal balances greater than
25% of borrower’s gross monthly income, lender did not properly enter loan(s) into the database on
the day made, and official income documentation was not the required type for a payday loan or was
not for income for the 30 days preceding the loan.

         American General Financial Services of Illinois, Inc., Galesburg - CILA license (937)
fined $40,000 for failure to contain evidence of a contract signed or acknowledged by the borrower
in the file.

       QC Financial Services, Inc., Waukegan - CILA license (2586) fined $7,900 for the
following violations: improper simple interest calculation, security is not properly disclosed, file
does not contain evidence of a contract signed or acknowledged by the borrower, incomplete,
incorrect or improper disclosure of itemization of amount financed, and wage assignment was
accepted from borrower that contained blank spaces.

       America’s Financial Choice, Inc., Chicago - PLRA license (1282) fined $5,000 for the
following violations: lender did not verify that the loan was permissible, lender did not enter into the
database the borrower’s loan was paid in full or cancelled on the day the transaction was made,
lender charged more than $15.50 per $100 loaned on a payday loan, and official income
documentation was not the required type for a payday loan or was not for income for the 30 days
preceding the loan.

       Illinois Title Loans, Inc., McHenry - PLRA license (1427) fined $4,500 for lender
presenting dishonored check, ACH debit, or other item more than twice.

       ACE Cash Express, Inc., d/b/a ACE Cash Advance, Loves Park - PLRA license (1408)
fined $4,000 for lender presenting dishonored check, ACH debit, or other item more than twice.

                                                 -3-
        Check Into Cash of Illinois, d/b/a Check Into Cash, Des Plaines – PLRA license (1210)
fined $3,975 for the following violations: the loan document or other legal instrument contains
blanks, original documents, or approved equivalent, not cancelled or returned following payoff,
lender did not enter into the database that the borrower’s loan was paid in full or cancelled on the
day the transaction was made, a partial payment on a PLRA loan or repayment plan was not entered
into the database on the date the transaction was made, and official income documentation was not
the required type for a payday loan or was not for income for the 30 days preceding the loan.

       America’s Financial Choice, Inc., Chicago - PLRA license (1286) fined $3,900 for the
following violations: lender did not verify that the loan was permissible, lender did not enter into the
database that the borrower’s loan was not paid in full or cancelled on the day the transaction was
made, lender did not obtain any official documentation of the borrower’s income before making a
payday loan, and lender made a payday loan with a term less than 13 days long.

        Budget Finance Corporation, Aurora - CILA license (807) fined $3,750 for failure to enter
into database that the borrower’s loan was paid in full or cancelled on the day the transaction was
made.

        Check Into Cash of Illinois, North Riverside - PLRA license (1229) fined $3,000 for
failure to enter into the database that the borrower’s loan was paid in full or canceled on the day the
transaction was made.

         QC Financial Services, Inc., Chicago Heights - CILA license (3216) fined $2,850 for
failure to properly disclose security.

       Illinois Catalog Sales, Inc., d/b/a ICS Loan, Columbus, GA - CILA license (2048) fined
$2,500 for the following violations: the file of original papers for the loan is not properly maintained,
licensee did not properly maintain loan records for two years after final entry, and security is not
properly disclosed.

       CMK Investments, Inc., d/b/a All Credit Lenders, Inc., Moline - CILA license (2686)
fined $2,250 for the following violations: licensee did not maintain a positive net worth of a
minimum of $30,000 and licensee did not provide requested documents or information during the
exam.

        Check Into Cash of Illinois, d/b/a Check Into Cash, Kankakee - PLRA license (1227)
fined $2,250 for the following violations: lender did not enter into the database that the borrower’s
loan was paid in full or cancelled on the day the transaction was made and lender did not obtain any
official documentation of the borrower’s income before making a payday loan.

        The MoneyPlace of Mt. Vernon, Inc., Mt. Vernon - CILA license (1863) fined $2,250 for
the following violations: improper simple interest calculation, security is not properly disclosed, the
payment record for a simple interest loan does not show the principal balance due, the date to which
interest is paid or itemized other charges collected, incomplete, and incorrect or improper disclosure
of itemization of amount financed.

       QC financial Services, Inc., d/b/a National Quick Cash, Berwyn - PLRA license (1261)
fined $2,150 for the following violations: the loan document or other legal instrument contains

                                                  -4-
 blanks, lender did not verify that the loan was permissible, and lender did not enter into the
database that the borrower’s loan was paid in full or cancelled on the day the transaction was made.

        The Payday Loan Store of Illinois, Inc., Burbank - PLRA license (1306) fined $2,000 for
the following violations: security is not properly disclosed, interest rate is insufficient, and evidence
of a signed or acknowledged truth-in lending disclosure is not in the file of original papers.

        SFC of Illinois, L.P., Rock Falls - CILA license (2404) fined $1,950 for the following
violations: security is not properly disclosed and interest rebate is insufficient.

       EZ Payday Advance, L.L.C., McHenry - CILA license (2244) fined $1,800 for failure to
properly disclose security.

        Illinois Title Loans, Inc., d/b/a Title Loans of America, Inc., North Aurora – CILA
license (1435) fined $1,550 for the following violations: improper simple interest calculations,
licensee did not send borrower a notice of the right to redeem with all required information, licensee
did not deliver or mail to the borrower an affidavit of defense, date of repossession not available,
licensee did not give written notice of intended sale/disposition of repossessed collateral including
all required information, licensee did not dispose of repossessed collateral in a commercially
reasonable manner, payment history of the repossession account does not properly identify the
proceeds from the sale of collateral, repossession file does not indicate a statement of final
accounting containing the required information was sent to the borrower, and repossession file does
not contain a copy of the condition of collateral at time of repossession.

        QC Financial Services, Inc., Berwyn - CILA license (2254) fined $1,350 for the following
violations: security is not properly disclosed and wage assignment was accepted from borrower that
contained blank spaces.

       QC Financial Services, Calumet City - CILA license (2247) fined $1,200 for failure to
properly disclose security.

        R&L Webb Enterprises, Inc., d/b/a Hamilton County loan Company, McLeansboro -
CILA license (2509) fined $1,100 for the following violations: licensee did not send borrower a
notice of the right to redeem with all required information, licensee did not deliver or mail to the
borrower an affidavit of defense, date of repossession not available, licensee did not give written
notice of intended sale/disposition or repossessed collateral including all required information,
licensee did not send borrower notice of intended sale/disposition of collateral via certified mail,
licensee did not dispose of reposed collateral in a commercially reasonable manner, repossession file
does not contain singed receipts showing all collateral purchased, the amount paid and the name of
the obligor, repossession file does not indicate a statement of final accounting containing the
required information was sent to the borrower, repossession file does not contain a copy of the
condition of collateral at time of repossession, the wording required by this section was not used in
the sale of the collateral, and the licensee did not have receipts to document charges in connection
with the sale of collateral.

       SFC of Illinois, L.P., Ottawa - CILA license (2433) fined $1,050 for failure to properly
disclose security.


                                                  -5-
       SFC of Illinois, L.P., Rochelle - CILA license (2405) fined $1,050 for failure to properly
disclose security.

        Lighthouse Financial group of IL, Inc., Oak Lawn - CILA license (1965) fined $1,050 for
the following violations: the annual percentage rate is not accurately disclosed, improper simple
interest calculations, and the loan contract does not accurately disclose the schedule of payments or
the total of payments.

        Central Illinois Loans, Inc., Canton - CILA license (3124) fined $1,000 for insufficient
interest rebate.

                                            Insurance
       Michael L. Smith, North Chicago – insurance producer license application denied due to
the applicant failing to reveal a previous suspension based on an unpaid tax liability thereby
providing incorrect and materially untrue information in the application. Failed to notify the
Division of his change of address, made threatening remarks to the Division investigator, and failed
to comply with two installment contracts with the Department of Revenue.

       Deane J. Pantaleo, Darien – insurance producer license revoked by Director’s Order from
Hearing #08-HR-0824. The hearing was held regarding the Department’s Order of Revocation dated
August 5, 2008. The Order of Revocation was issued as a result of an investigation revealing Mr.
Pantaleo had an Order of Revocation regarding his registration as an investment advisor and a
salesperson in the State of Illinois, issued by the Secretary of State Securities Division.


         Alfonso J. Vruno, Geneva – insurance producer license revoked after revealing Mr. Vruno
had been permanently prohibited from offering or selling any securities in the State of Illinois and
his registration as a salesperson of securities in the State of Illinois was revoked May 24, 2002 by the
Illinois Secretary of State; misappropriated more than $40,000.00 from a consumer; claimed

                                                 -6-
bankruptcy on fiduciary monies; and failed to repay the consumer and company when payment was
requested.

                                  MEDICAL CORPORATION

       Michael Reicher, Belvidere, Dean Whitcomb, Rockford, Neck to Back, Ltd., Rockford,
Neck to Back Rockford, LLC, Rockford, Neck to Back Quad Cities, LLC, Rockford, Neck to
                                          - 12 -
        Back Springfield, LLC, and Neck to Back Peoria, Rockford – (unlicensed) all ordered to
cease and desist ownership, management and operation of any clinic or clinics that engage in
practice of medicine or chiropractic and shall not acquire any shares of ownership interest in any
clinic or clinics that engage in the practice of medicine or chiropractic, whether its partnership,
corporation, limited liability corporation or any other structure of ownership.

Illinois Department of Financial and
Professional Regulation
Division of Professional Regulation                         NEWS
           SPRINGFIELD, IL - The Illinois Department of Financial and Professional Regulation
    (IDFPR) announced today that the Director of the Division of Professional Regulation, Daniel E.
    Bluthardt, signed the following disciplinary actions taken during the month of February, 2009.


              ARCHITECTS, LAND SURVEYORS, PROFESSIONAL ENGINEERS
                           AND STRUCTURAL ENGINEERS

          Manuel Palma, Chicago – land surveyor license (035-002135) fined $250 for sealing a
    Surveyor's Certificate on a sheet of paper that was not a survey.

            Richard Vane, Palatine – professional engineer license (062-038790) fined $1,500 for
    instructing an employee to make an unauthorized change to a land survey.

    criminal conviction for which he has completed the sentence.

$10,000 after he advertised chiropractic services while his license was suspended and failed to
pay a fine imposed by the Department against his license.

       Wayne Lewis Kohlmeier, Waterloo – chiropractic license (038-003378) reprimanded
and fined $500 for a misleading advertisement.

Lonnie W. Lynch, Jr., Newnan, GA – (unlicensed) ordered to cease and desist the unlicensed
practice of chiropractic medicine.

                                                            - 12 -
  Illinois Department of Financial and
  Professional Regulation                                          NEWS
SPRINGFIELD - The Illinois Department of Financial and Professional Regulation (IDFPR)
announced today that directors of Professional Regulation, Daniel E. Bluthardt; Financial
Institutions, Robert Meza; Insurance, Michael T. McRaith; and Banking, Jorge A. Solis signed the
following disciplinary orders in the month of March 2009.


                                               Banks
                                BANK AND TRUST COMPANIES

       First State Bank of Red Bud, Red Bud – entered into a written agreement with the Illinois
Department of Financial and Professional Regulation and the Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis
with respect to the banks unsafe and unsound practices effective March 17, 2009.

                                              -5-
                                      Financial Institutions
                       Note: If a licensee has exercised its right to a hearing
                      pursuant to statute, an order on this list may not be final.

                                         CONSUMER CREDIT

        Americash Loans, LLC, Chicago – PLRA license (1372) fined $77,350 for the following
violations: licensee does not keep a separate, complete file for each obligor, file did not contain a
promissory note in the file, evidence of a signed or acknowledged Truth-In-Lending Disclosure is
not in the file of original papers, file does not contain evidence of a Wage Assignment signed by the
wage earner, and file does not contain evidence of a contract signed or acknowledged by the borrower.

        Americash Loans, LLC, Chicago – CILA license (2063) fined $69,150 for the following
violations: the annual percentage rate is not accurately disclosed, licensee does not keep a separate,
complete file for each obligor, file did not contain a promissory note in the file, judgment obtained
for incorrect amount or included additional fees not allowed, files did not contain the security
agreement, and file does not contain evidence of a contract signed or acknowledged by the borrower.

        America’s Financial Choice, Inc., Oak Park – PLRA license (1279) fined $21,400 for the
following violations: original documents, or approved equivalent, not cancelled or returned following
payoff, lender did not verify that the loan was permissible, lender did not enter into the database that the
borrower’s loan was paid in full or cancelled on the day the transaction was made, lender did not have a
ready supply of the Illinois guide to Payday Loans pamphlets to provide borrowers, lender charged more
than $15.50 per $100 loaned on a payday loan, lender did not properly enter loan(s) into the database on
the day made, a partial payment on a PLRA loan or repayment plan was not entered into the database on
the date the transaction was made, and official income documentation was not the required type for a
payday loan or was not for income for the 30 days preceding the loan.

       America’s Financial Choice, Inc., Chicago – CILA license (1717) fined $14,700 for the
following violations: the annual percentage rate is not accurately disclosed and security is not
properly disclosed.

        Devon Financial Services, Inc. Chicago – CILA license (3411) fined $11,650 for the
following violations: licensee did not operate under licensed name, improper simple interest
calculation, licensee’s or retail seller’s name and address is not properly disclosed on legal document,
and the loan contract does not accurately disclose the schedule of payments or the total of payments.

        The Payday Loan Store of Illinois, Inc., Melrose Park – CILA license (2182) fined $8,150
for the following violations: the annual percentage rate is not accurately disclosed and improper
simple interest calculations.

         America’s Financial Choice, Inc., Calumet City – PLRA license (1284) fined $7,750 for the
following violations: lender did not verify the loan was permissible, lender did not enter into the database
that the borrower’s loan was paid in full or cancelled on the day the transaction was made, and lender
charged more than $15.50 per $100 loaned on a payday loan.

       America’s Financial Choice, Inc., Chicago – PLRA license (1281) fined $6,775 for the
following violations: security is not properly disclosed, original documents, or approved equivalent,
not cancelled or returned following payoff, and lender did not enter into the database that the
borrower’s loan was paid in full or cancelled on the day the transaction was made.
                                                    -6-
       Devon Financial Services, Inc., Chicago – PLRA license (1609) fined $6,150 for the
following violations: licensee not operating under licensed name, licensee’s or retail seller’s name
and address is not properly disclosed on legal document, and lender did not verify the loan was
permissible.

       Citizens Finance Company, d/b/a Citizens Finance of Illinois, Loves Park – CILA license
(1827) fined $5,700 for failure to properly disclose security.

        The Payday Loan Store of Illinois, Inc., Chicago – CILA license (1531) fined $5,250 for
the following violations: improper simple interest calculations, licensee did not send borrower a
Notice of the Right to Redeem with all required information, licensee did not deliver or mail to the
borrower an affidavit of defense, date of repossession not available in the account record, licensee
did not give written notice of intended sale/disposition of repossessed collateral including all
required information, payment history of the repossession account does not properly identify the
proceeds from the sale of collateral, repossession file does not contain signed receipts showing the
collateral purchased, the amount paid and the name of the obligor, repossession file does not indicate
a statement of final accounting containing the required information was sent to the borrower,
repossession file does not contain a copy of the condition of collateral at time of repossession, the
licensee did not have receipts to document charges in connection with the sale of collateral, and file
does not contain evidence of a contract signed or acknowledged by the borrower.

        QC Financial Services, Inc., d/b/a National Quik Cash, Chicago – PLRA license (1256)
fined $5,200 for the following violations: lender did not verify that the loan was permissible, lender
did not enter into the database that the borrower’s loan was paid in full or cancelled on the day the
transaction was made, and lender did not properly enter loan(s) into the database on the day made.

        Citizens Finance Company, d/b/a Citizens Finance of Illinois, Crystal Lake – CILA
license (2895) fined $4,950 for failure to properly disclose security.

       QC Financial Services, Inc., d/b/a National Quik Cash, Chicago – PLRA license (1270)
fined $4,000 for the following violations: lender did not obtain any official documentation of the
borrower’s income before making a payday loan, loans over 25% of borrower’s income, and lender
made a payday loan resulting in the borrower having a combined outstanding payday loan principal
balances greater than 25% of borrower’s gross monthly income.

        The Payday Loan Store of Illinois, Inc., Country Club Hills – CILA license (1698) fined
$4,000 for the following violations: the annual percentage rate is not accurately disclosed, improper
simple interest calculations, security is not properly disclosed, evidence of a signed or acknowledged
Truth-In Lending Disclosure is not in the file of original papers, and repossession file does not
indicate a statement of final accounting containing the required information was sent to the
borrower.

        Advance America, Cash Advance Centers of IL, Inc., d/b/a Advance America, Cash
Adv. Ctrs., Alton – CILA license (1658) fined $3,775 for the following violations: the first
installment period exceeds one month by more than fifteen days and the repayment receipt does not
accurately show the required elements.

       The Payday Loan Store of Illinois, Inc., Lyons – CILA license (1697) fined $3,650 for the
following violations: improper simple interest calculations and repossession file does not indicate a
statement of final accounting containing the required information was sent to the borrower.
                                                 -7-
        Cash To Go at Wheeling, Palatine – CILA license (2959) fined $3,525 for the following
violations: security is not properly disclosed, lender does not have possession of the original title
registered to the borrower(s) on the short term loan, and security is not released.

       America’s Financial Choice, Inc., Oak Park – CILA license (1273) fined $2,700 for the
following violations: improper simple interest calculations and security is not properly disclosed.

        Illinois Title Loans, Inc., Calumet City – PLRA license (1440) fined $2,500 for the
following violations: lender did not enter into the database that the borrower’s loan was paid in full
or cancelled on the day the transaction was made, lender did not obtain any official documentation
of the borrower’s income before making a payday loan, loans over 25% of borrower’s income, and
lender made a payday loan resulting in the borrower having a combined outstanding payday loan
principal balances greater than 25% of borrower’s gross monthly income.

       B&B Investment Group, d/b/a Cash Loans Now, Moline – CILA license (2723) fined
$2,400 for the following violations: licensee did not maintain a positive net worth of a minimum of
$30,000, the loan document or other legal instrument contains blanks, and licensee did not provide
requested documents or information during the exam.

         Heights Finance Corporation, Kankakee – CILA license (1998) fined $2,400 for the
following violations: the loan document or other legal instrument contains blanks, security is not
properly disclosed, and evidence of a signed or acknowledged Truth-In Lending Disclosure is no in
the file of original papers.

        Midwest Title Loans, Inc., Grayville – CILA license (3297) fined $2,075 for the following
violations: licensed location did not prominently display the hours of operation, licensed location did
not prominently display the license or renewal certificate, the licensed location does not maintain a
complete permanent file, and licensee did not maintain a positive net worth of $30,000.

       Cottonwood Financial Illinois, LLC d/b/a The Cash Store, Marion – PLRA license
(1575) fined $2,050 for the following violations: original documents, or approved equivalent, not
cancelled or returned following payoff, lender did not obtain any official documentation of the
borrower’s income before making a payday loan, and official income documentation was not the
required type for a payday loan or was not for income for the 30 days preceding the loan.

       Check Into Cash of Illinois, LLC, d/b/a Check Into Cash, Chicago – PLRA license
(1231) fined $1,750 for failure to enter into the database that the borrower’s loan was paid in full or
cancelled on the day the transaction was made.

         The Payday Loan Store of Illinois, Inc., Joliet – CILA license (2183) fined $1,550 for the
following violations: improper simple interest calculation, evidence of a signed or acknowledged
Truth-In Lending Disclosure is not in the file or original papers, evidence of a Truth-In Lending
Disclosure is not in the file of original papers, licensee did not properly post the sale of collateral or
proceeds to the account record, payment history of the repossession account does not properly identify
the proceeds from the sale of collateral, repossession file does not contain signed receipts showing the
collateral purchased, the amount paid and the name of the obligor, repossession file does not indicate a
statement of final accounting containing the required information was sent to the borrower,
repossession file does not contain a copy of the condition of collateral at time of repossession, the
licensee did not have receipts to document charges in connection with sale of collateral, and licensee
failed to properly document the disposition date of collateral.
                                                      -8-
        American General Financial Services of Illinois, Inc., Hanover Park – CILA license
(611) fined $1,450 for the following violations: the loan document or other legal instrument contains
blanks, licensee did not dispose of repossessed collateral in a commercially reasonable manner,
repossession file does not contain signed receipts showing the collateral purchased, the amount paid
and the name of the obligor, repossession file does not indicate a statement of final accounting
containing the required information was sent to the borrower, repossession file does not contain a
copy of the condition of collateral at time of repossession, and file does not contain evidence of a
contract signed or acknowledged by borrower.

        Midwest Title Loans, Inc., Summit – CILA license (1843) fined $1,350 for the following
violations: licensee did not send borrower a notice of the Right to Redeem with all the required
information, licensee did not give written notice of right to recover to buyer within 3 days of
repossession of collateral, licensee did not deliver or mail to the borrower an affidavit of defense,
licensee did not give written notice of intended sale/disposition of reposed collateral including all
required information, repossession file does not contain signed receipts showing the collateral
purchased, the amount paid and the name of the obligor, repossession file does not indicate a
statement of final accounting containing the required information was sent to the borrower, and
repossession file does not contain a copy of the condition of collateral at time of repossession.

       Get It Now, LLC, d/b/a Home Choice, Rockford – SFA license (1240) fined $1,350 for the
following violations: licensee moved without 10 day notice or the applicable preapproval from the
Director, the annual percentage rate is not accurately disclosed, and amendment to closed-end
contract or retail contract was not signed by obligor and lender.

        One Iron Ventures, Inc., d/b/a First Cash Advance, Chicago – PLRA license (1292) fined
$1,150 for the following violations: loans over 25% of borrower’s income, Lender made a payday
loan resulting in the borrower having combined outstanding payday loan principal balance greater
than 25% of borrower’s gross monthly income, and wage assignment was accepted from borrower
that contained blank spaces.

       Honor Finance Corporation, Evanston – SFA license (1021) fined $1,000 for the
following violations: improper simple interest calculation and repossession file does not contain a
copy of the condition of collateral at time of repossession.

       Cashland Financial Services, Inc., Danville – PLRA license (1548) fined $1,000 for
making a payday loan resulting in the borrower having a combined outstanding payday loan
principal balance greater than 25% of borrower’s gross monthly income.

       Advance America, Cash Advance Centers of IL, Inc., d/b/a Advance America, Cash
Adv. Ctrs., Loves Park – CILA license (1524) fined $1,000 for failure to accurately show the
required elements on the payment receipt.

       Cottonwood Financial Illinois, LLC, d/b/a/ The Cash Store, Carbondale – PLRA license
(1578) fined $1,000 for official income documentation not being the required type for a payday loan

         The Payday Loan Store of Illinois, Inc., Chicago – CILA license (2123) fined $1,000 for
failure to contain evidence of a contract signed or acknowledged by the borrower in the file.

                                             ###




                                             - 26 -
  Illinois Department of Financial and
  Professional Regulation                                       NEWS
SPRINGFIELD - The Illinois Department of Financial and Professional Regulation (IDFPR)
announced today that directors of Professional Regulation, Daniel E. Bluthardt; Financial
Institutions, Robert Meza; Insurance, Michael T. McRaith; and Banking, Jorge A. Solis signed the
following disciplinary orders in the month of April 2009.



                                             Banks
                               BANK AND TRUST COMPANIES

       Bank of Lincolnwood, Lincolnwood – ordered to cease and desist from engaging in unsafe
and unsound banking practices effective April 21, 2009.


                                          PAWNSHOPS

         Alton Pawn Shop, Inc., Alton – pawnshop ordered to pay a $600 civil penalty for failing to
file their 2008 Pawnshop Disclosure of Business Activities Report in a timely manner.

         C.B.J. Corporation, Chicago – pawnshop ordered to pay a $150 civil penalty for failing to
file their 2008 Pawnshop Disclosure of Business Activities Report in a timely manner.

         For What It’s Worth, Harvey – pawnshop ordered to pay a $1,000 civil penalty for failing
to file their 2008 Pawnshop Disclosure of Business Activities Report.

         P and P Pawn, Galesburg – pawnshop ordered to pay a $1,000 civil penalty for failing to
file their 2008 Pawnshop Disclosure of Business Activities Report.

         Pawn Central, Rock Island - pawnshop ordered to pay a $150 civil penalty for failing to
file their 2008 Pawnshop Disclosure of Business Activities Report in a timely manner.

        Prairie Street Pawn Shop, Galesburg – pawnshop ordered to pay a $150 civil penalty for
failing to file their 2008 Pawnshop Disclosure of Business Activities Report in a timely manner.

                                       LOAN ORIGINATORS

        Daniel Ford, Glen Ellyn – LO registration (031.0006626) placed in refuse to renew status due to
tax violations and inability to demonstrate financial responsibility in violation of the Act and Rules.

       Carlos A Gomez, Chicago – LO registration (031.0005598) revoked due to false and
dishonest representations and dealings in violation of the Act and Rules.

       Zenaida R. Aquitania, Carol Stream – ordered to cease and desist and fined $950 for
performing loan originator activities without a loan originator registration.



                                    Financial Institutions
                          Note: If a licensee has exercised its right to a hearing
                         pursuant to statute, an order on this list may not be final.


                                        CONSUMER CREDIT

       AAA Checkmate, L.L.C., Summit – CILA license (2037) fined $25,000 for failure to contain
evidence of a contract signed or acknowledged by the borrower in the file.

       Oasis Legal Finance, LLC., Northbrook – CILA license (2637) fined $6,000 for improper
simple interest calculations.



                                                    -3-
        The Payday Loan Store of Illinois, Inc., Lyons – PLRA license (1336) fined $9,750 for
the following violations: lender did not obtain any official documentation of the borrower’s income
before making a payday loan, payday lender did not provide the required notice of the consumer’s
right to a repayment plan in a separate signed written document, and official income documentation
was not the required type for a payday loan or was not for income for the 30 days preceding the loan.

         Midwestern Financial Corporation, Orland Park – SF license (469) fined $5,975 for the
following violations: licensed location did not prominently display the hours of operation, improper
simple interest calculations, licensee does not keep a separate, complete file for each obligor, licensee’s
or retail seller’s name and address is not properly disclosed on legal document, wage assignment was
accepted from borrower that contained blank spaces, and executed copy of paid contract or other legal
document retained in file but not stamped “PAID IN FULL” or equivalent.

         Illinois Catalog Sales, Inc. d/b/a ICS Loans, Joliet – CILA license (1890) fined $5,575 dollars
for the following violations: licensed location did not prominently display the hours of operation, the
annual percentage rate is not properly disclosed, improper simple interest calculations, the loan contract
does not accurately disclose the schedule of payments or the total of payments, the payment receipt does
not accurately show the required elements, the payment record for a simple interest loan does not show
the principal balance due, the date to which interest is paid or itemize other charges collected, and Truth
in Lending box is not properly completed.

       Advance America, Cash Advance Centers of IL, Inc. d/b/a Advance America, Cash
Advance Centers, Mount Vernon – CILA license (1661) fined $5,400 for failure to accurately
show the required elements on the payment receipt.

        Devon Financial Services, Oak Lawn – PLRA license (1496) fined $4,050 for the
following violations: the loan document or other legal instrument contains blanks, the file of original
papers for the loan is not properly maintained, Licensee’s or retail seller’s name and address is not
properly disclosed on legal document, evidence of a signed or acknowledged Truth-In-Lending
disclosure is not in the file of original papers, lender did not enter into the database that the
borrower’s loan was paid in full or cancelled on the day the transaction was made, file does not
contain evidence of a wage assignment signed by the wage earner, the lender made a payday loan
but there is no evidence of a signed, written agreement, loans over 25% of borrower’s income, and
lender made a payday loan resulting in the borrower having a combined outstanding payday loan
principal balances greater than 25% of borrower’s gross monthly income.

        Devon Financial Services, Chicago – PLRA license (1319) fined $3,000 for failure to obtain
any official documentation of the borrower’s income before making a payday or title-secured loan.

       ACE Cash Express, Inc. d/b/a ACE Cash Advance, Rockford – PLRA license (1409) fined
$5,000 for presenting dishonored check, ACH debit, or other item more than twice.

        Brother Loan & Finance Company, Summit – CILA license (642) fined $3,000 for failure to
contain evidence of a signed or acknowledged Truth-In-Lending disclosure in the file of original papers.

       Illinois Lending Corporation, Orland Park – CILA license (2577) fined $2,250 for the
following violations: licensee does not keep a separate complete file for each obligor and the
payment receipt does not accurately show the required elements.

      Wilshire Commercial Capital, LLC d/b/a Wilshire Consumer Credit, Los Angeles, CA
– CILA license (3318) fined $1,125 for failure to accurately disclose the finance charge.
                                                 -4-
        Express Title & Payday Loans, Inc., Wheeling – CILA license (2071) fined $2,000 for the
following violations: the annual percentage rate is not accurately disclosed, the loan document or
other legal instrument contains blanks, improper simple interest calculations, and false advertising:
lender’s advertising, signage or other promotional material uses the term “payday” but the examiner
found that the lender does not offer payday loans.

       The Payday loan Store of Illinois, Inc., Oak Lawn – PLRA license (1300) fined $2,000
for making loans over 25% of borrower’s income, lender made a payday loan resulting in the
borrower having a combined outstanding payday loan principal balances greater than 25% of
borrower’s gross monthly income.

        Devon Financial Services, Oak Lawn – CILA license (3212) fined $1,900 for the following
violations: licensee not operating under licensed name, security is not properly disclosed, and
licensee’s or retail seller’s name and address is not properly disclosed on legal document.

        E-Loan, Inc., Pleasanton, CA – CILA license (2664) fined $1,650 for the following
violations: licensee charged a fee not allowed and the disclosure of variable rate terms does not meet
Truth-In-Lending requirements.

        One Iron Ventures, Inc. d/b/a First Cash Advance, Dolton – PLRA license (1290) fined
$1,150 for the following violations: loans over 25% of borrower’s income, lender made a payday
loan resulting in the borrower having a combined outstanding payday loan principal balances greater
than 25% of borrower’s gross monthly income, and wage assignment was accepted from the
borrower that contained blank spaces.

       One Iron Ventures, Inc. d/b/a First Cash Advance, Matteson – CILA license (1533) fined
$1,500 for failure to properly complete the Truth-In-Lending box.

       Title Lenders, Inc. d/b/a USA Payday Loans, Collinsville – CILA license (2680) fined
$1,200 for the following violations: the annual percentage rate is not accurately disclosed and
improper simple interest calculation.

       Pronto Finance Group, LLC d/b/a Pronto Prestamos, Elgin – CILA license (2954) fined
$1,200 for failure to contain the rule of 78 example on the loan contract.

        Personal Finance Company LLC, Joliet – CI/SF license (637) fined $1,050 for the
following violations: the annual percentage rate is not accurately disclosed, the loan document or
other legal instrument contains blanks, security is not properly disclosed, the loan contract does not
accurately disclose the schedule of payments or the total of payments, and the payment schedule
does not accurately disclose the first payment date.

        United Fast Cash Inc., Peoria – CILA license (1571) fined $1,050 for the following
violations: the loan document or other legal instrument contains blanks, the file of original papers for
the loan is not properly maintained, and security is not released.

       Injury Case Funding, St. Louis, MO – CILA license (3224) fined $1,000 for failure to
contain evidence of a contract signed or acknowledged by the borrower in the file.

       QC Financial Services, Inc., Berwyn – CILA license (2254) fined $1,000 for failure to contain
evidence of a contract signed or acknowledged by the borrower in the file.

                                                ###




                                                - 16 -
  Illinois Department of Financial and
  Professional Regulation                                        NEWS
SPRINGFIELD - The Illinois Department of Financial and Professional Regulation (IDFPR)
announced today that directors of Professional Regulation, Daniel E. Bluthardt; Financial
Institutions, Robert Meza; and Banking, Jorge A. Solis signed the following disciplinary orders in
the month of May 2009.


                                              Banks

                               BANK AND TRUST COMPANIES

       Strategic Capital Bank, Champaign – Division of Banking took possession and control of
bank on May 22, 2009 for the purpose of receivership.


                                  RESIDENTIAL MORTGAGE

         Trust One Mortgage Corporation, Oak Brook – residential mortgage license (MB.6759722)
revoked for violations found in examination and investigation, including improper loan notices and
activities with consumers.

         Nationwide Lending Corporation, Irvine, CA – residential mortgage license (MB.0005867)
revoked for violations found in examination, including unregistered loan originator activities and
failure to maintain minimum net worth.

        Treehouse Lending, Chicago – residential mortgage license (MB.0006431) revoked for
failure to submit to examination.


                                     LOAN ORIGINATORS

       Roberto Delgado, Montgomery – LO registration (031.0017082) fined $2,500 for allowing
expired loan originator registrants to use his registration number to approve loan documents.

       Martin Enciso, Oswego – LO registration (031.0015068) fined $1,000 for originating loans
using another loan originator’s registration number when his was expired.



                                                -1-
       David Offett, Markham – LO registration (030.0025590) revoked due to his involvement in
a mortgage fraud scheme.

       Ricardo Reyes, Oswego – LO registration (031.0013052) fined $1,000 for originating loans
using another loan originator’s registration number when his expired.

       Paul Shelton, Hinsdale – LO registration (031.0025067) revoked due to his involvement in
a mortgage fraud scheme.

        Mike Skerlak, Naperville – LO registration (031.0014368) fined $2,500 for conducting loan
origination activities without being registered.

      Michael Tadros, St. Petersburg, FL – LO registration (031.0026151) fined $1,000 for
conducting loan origination activities without being registered.

      Nevene Tadros, St. Petersburg, FL.– LO registration (031.0023602) fined $1,000 for
conducting loan origination activities without being registered.

       James Taylor, Glendale Heights – LO registration (031.00005703) revoked due to his
involvement in a mortgage fraud scheme.

       Jeffery Watkins, Glendale Heights – LO registration (031.0015965) revoked due to his
involvement in a mortgage fraud scheme.

        Percilla Moreno, Oak Brook – ordered to cease and desist and fined $5,000 for performing
loan originator activities without a loan originator registration and her involvement in a mortgage
fraud scheme.



                                    Financial Institutions
                          Note: If a licensee has exercised its right to a hearing
                         pursuant to statute, an order on this list may not be final.


                                        CONSUMER CREDIT

        CCO Illinois, Inc., Provo, UT – PLRA license (1516) fined $22,250 for the following
violations: lender imposed on borrower fees or charges other than those specifically authorized by
the Payday Loan Reform Act; lender did not verify that the loan was permissible; lender did not
enter into the database that the borrower’s loan was paid in full or cancelled on the day the
transaction was made; lender did not obtain any official documentation of the borrower’s income
before making a payday or title-secured loan; lender did not provide the required notice of the
consumer’s right to a repayment in a separate signed written document; and lender charged more
than $15.50 per $100 loaned on a payday loan.

       KB Investments, Inc., Moline – CILA license (3353) fined $6,400 for not operating under
licensed name and the loan documents or other legal instruments contain blanks.



                                                    -2-
        Advance LLC d/b/a Advance ‘Til Friday, Kewanee – CILA license (2742) fined $4,650 for
the following violations: security was not properly disclosed; loan contract did not accurately disclose
the schedule of payments or the total of payments; loan documents did not properly disclose the
method and conditions of prepayment penalty or does not meet TILA requirements; truth-in- lending
box was not completed properly; and improper accounting of principal and interest payment.

       Fast Cash U.S.A., Inc., Richton Park – CILA license (2583) fined $3,750 for failure to
properly disclose security.

       Devon Financial Services, Inc., Maywood – PLRA license (1321) fined $3,150 for failure
to properly disclose retail seller’s name and address on legal document.



                                              Professional Regulation

                ARCHITECTS, LAND SURVEYORS, PROFESSIONAL ENGINEERS
                             AND STRUCTURAL ENGINEERS

       Garret Eakin, Oak Park – architect license (001-009672) placed on probation for one year
and fined $2,500 due to unlicensed practice.

        David Huering, New Berlin – architect license (001-013564) placed in refuse-to-renew
status for not completing work in a timely manner and for substandard work.

       Michel Ensalaco, Montgomery – professional land surveyor license (035-002768) fined
$2,000 for failure to meet the minimum standards of practice for professional land surveying.

Illinois Department of Financial and
Professional Regulation
Division of Professional Regulation                                          NEWS
           SPRINGFIELD, IL - The Illinois Department of Financial and Professional Regulation
    (IDFPR) announced today that the Director of the Division of Professional Regulation, Daniel E.
    Bluthardt, signed the following disciplinary actions taken during the month of June, 2009.


                                                     ACCOUNTANT

            Christopher Anderson, Lake Forest – certified public accountant license (065-027203)
    indefinitely suspended following suspension from practice by the PCAOB.

           Michael Kern, Mundelein – public accountant license (239-018504) placed in refuse to
    renew status after defaulting on an Illinois educational loan.


                                                    ACUPUNCTURE

            Taryn De Cicco, Buffalo Grove – acupuncture license (198-000665) and dietitian
    nutritionist license (164-002932) ordered to cease and desist the unlicensed practice of medicine
    by use of terms Dr. or Doctor on business cards and/or advertisement and assessed a civil penalty
    of $1,000.

                                               - 22 -
  Illinois Department of Financial and
  Professional Regulation                                        NEWS
SPRINGFIELD - The Illinois Department of Financial and Professional Regulation (IDFPR)
announced today that directors of Professional Regulation, Daniel E. Bluthardt; Financial
Institutions, Robert Meza; and Banking, Jorge A. Solis signed the following disciplinary orders in
the month of August 2009.



                                      Division of Banking
                               BANK AND TRUST COMPANIES

      Mortgage Source, LLC, Garden City, NY – ordered to cease and desist using a bank’s
name without permission effective August 3, 2009.

       InBank, Oak Forest – ordered to cease and desist from engaging in unsafe and unsound
banking practices effective August 17, 2009.

found in examination.

                                          LOAN ORIGINATORS

        Se Han Lee, Mundelein – LO registration (031.0006507) fined $2,500 for conducting loan
origination activities without being registered to the Licensee.

       Jeffrey McClure, Barrington – LO registration (031.0025658) placed on suspension for
180 days and fined $5,000 for using another loan orginator’s credentials to originate loans before
obtaining a loan originator registration.

        Derwin Moore, Berkeley – issued a Cease and Desist Order and fined $5,000 for conducting
loan originating without a registration.

        Charlotte Prill, Algonquin – LO registration (031.0013035) revoked due to being convicted
of a financially related crime and for not reporting the conviction to the Department.

        Juan M. Silva, Plainfield – LO registration (031.0008942) fined $5,000 for falsifying his
loan originator renewal application.

       Edison Torres, Lansing – LO registration (031.0012709) placed on suspension for 180 days
and fined $5,000 for allowing an unregistered loan originator use his credentials to originate loans.


                                  Division of Financial Institutions
                             Note: If a licensee has exercised its right to a hearing
                            pursuant to statute, an order on this list may not be final.


                                           CONSUMER CREDIT

        AFC LLC d/b/a Greater Affiliated Financial LLC, Sunrise, FL – SFA license (1227)
fined $1,050 for the following violations: licensee disposed of collateral during the redemption
period, licensee did not send borrower a Notice of the Right to Redeem with all required
information, repossession file did not contain a copy of the condition of collateral at time of
repossession, repossession file did not indicate a statement of final accounting containing the
required information was sent to the borrower, and licensee did not give written notice of intended
sale/disposition of repossessed collateral including all required information.



                                                       -4-
        Easy Acceptance, Inc., Chicago - SF license (1296) fined $8,850 for the following
violations: licensee did not have receipts to document charges in connection with the sale of
collateral, repossession file did not contain a copy of the condition of collateral at time of
repossession, repossession file did not indicate a statement of final accounting containing the
required information was sent to borrower, repossession file did not contain signed receipts showing
the collateral purchased, the amount paid and the name of the obligor, payment history of the
repossession account does not properly identify the proceeds from the sale of collateral, licensee did
not give written notice of intended sale/disposition of reposed collateral including all required
information, date of repossession not available in the account record, licensee did not deliver or mail
to the borrower an affidavit of defense, licensee disposed of collateral during the redemption period,
licensee did not send borrower a Notice of Right to Redeem with all required information, and
security not properly disclosed.

        E-Z Case Loans, LLC, Deerfield - CILA license (3016) fined $2,250 for improper simple
interest calculations.

         Global Funding Solutions, LLC, Chicago - CILA license (3450) fined $4,800 for the
following violations: annual percentage rate and finance charge in the truth-in-lending disclosure are
not more conspicuous than the other items in the disclosure and amendment to closed-end contract
or retail contract was not signed by obligor and lender.

        Illinois Title Loans, Inc. Title Loans of America, Inc., Atlanta, GA - CILA license (1916)
fined $2,250 for the following violations: licensee did not give written notice of intended
sale/disposition of reposed collateral including all required information, licensee did not deliver or
mail to the borrower an affidavit of defense, licensee did not send borrower a Notice of the Right to
Redeem with all required information, Title-secured lender did not obtain borrower’s most recent
income documentation available at the time the loan was made, lender made a title-secured loan with
a scheduled monthly payment exceeding 50% of the obligor’s gross monthly income, and licensee
did not properly maintain loan records for two years after final entry.

       Short Term Loans, LLC, Des Plaines – PLRA license (1389) fined $1,400 for the
following violations: official income documentation was not the required type for a payday loan or
was not for income for the 30 days preceding the loan, loans over 25% of borrower’s income, lender
made a payday loan resulting in the borrower having combined outstanding payday loan principal
balances greater than 25% of borrower’s gross monthly income, and lender did not enter into the
database that the borrower’s loan was paid in full or cancelled on the day the transaction was made.

        U.S. Cash Advance Illinois, L.L.C., d/b/a The Loan Machine, St. Louis, MO – CILA
license (1805) fined $2,600 for the following violations: Security not properly disclosed and licensee
did not properly maintain loan records for two years after final entry.


                                    CURRENCY EXCHANGES

         Crest Currency Exchange Inc., Chicago – currency exchange license (621) fined $1,700
for failure to maintain the statutorily required minimum net worth.

       Lawrence Elston #7 Currency Exchange Inc., Chicago – currency exchange license
(3522) fined $1,800 for failure to maintain the statutorily required minimum net worth.

       Tonya Harvey, Olympia Fields – real estate broker license (475-110797) reprimanded and
placed on probation for one year for failure to timely return earnest money to a client.

       Loretta Grigler, Chicago – real estate salesperson license (476-426095) revoked and fined
$5,000 for practicing real estate with an inoperative license.

       Stuart Kaiserman, Highland Park – real estate salesperson license (476-286101) revoked
and fined $3,000 for practicing real estate with an expired license.

        Gregory Darling, Evanston – certified residential real estate appraiser license (556-003342)
placed in refuse to renew status for failing to use due diligence in the completion of appraisal reports.

       Mark Jeffers, Chicago – certified residential real estate appraiser license (556-003222)
suspended for ten years and fined $5,000 for failure to comply with the continuing education
requirements for license renewal.

        James Perisin, Chicago – certified residential real estate appraiser license (556-002918)
indefinitely suspended for a minimum of five years for completing a deficient and misleading
appraisal report.

        Eva Voss, Crystal Lake – certified residential real estate appraiser license (556-003402)
placed in refuse to renew status for failing to use due diligence in the completion of appraisal reports.

        Jones Community Auction Center, Quincy – (unlicensed) assessed a civil penalty of $500
for unlicensed auctioneering, owned a licensed auction company and utilized a licensed auctioneer,
however on one occasion, he wrongfully conducted an auction.

        Michael Levine, Chicago – (unlicensed) assessed a $3,000 civil penalty and must apply for
broker's license for practicing real estate without a license.

       Christian Pavden, Chicago – (unlicensed) assessed a $15,000 civil penalty for engaging in
unlicensed practice of real estate.

                                                - 20 -
Illinois Department of Financial and
Professional Regulation
                                                                 NEWS
           SPRINGFIELD - The Illinois Department of Financial and Professional Regulation
   (IDFPR) announced today that directors of Professional Regulation, Daniel E. Bluthardt;
   Financial Institutions, Robert Meza; and Banking, Jorge A. Solis signed the following
   disciplinary orders in the month of September 2009.



                                      Division of Banking

                                BANK AND TRUST COMPANIES

         Freedom Bank, Sterling – ordered to cease and desist from engaging in unsafe and
   unsound banking practices.

           Highland Community Bank, Chicago – ordered to cease and desist from engaging in
   unsafe and unsound banking practices.

          InBank, Oak Forest – Division of Banking took possession and control of bank for the
   purpose of receivership.

          Independent Bankers’ Bank of Illinois, Springfield – ordered to cease and desist from
   engaging in unsafe and unsound banking practices.

          Valley Bank, Moline – ordered to cease and desist from engaging in unsafe and unsound
   banking practices.

   for failing to file their 2009 license renewal in a timely manner.

                            Division of Financial Institutions
                                    CONSUMER CREDIT

         Express Auto Title Loans, Inc., 251 East Dundee Road, Wheeling – CILA License
(2071) fined $15,400 for the following violations: The title-secured loan or refinancing
agreement did not contain the required initialed statement providing DFI’s toll-free number to
call for Debt Management Service information, the title-secured loan agreement did not contain a
separate statement signed by the borrower that he/she has not had an outstanding title-secured
loan in the last 15 days, the title-secured loan agreement did not prominently disclose DFI’s
address and phone number and advise the borrower of the right to report lending and collection
violations, the lender took security other than the vehicle on a title-secured loan, title-secured
lender did not obtain borrower’s appropriate or most recent income documentation available at
the time the loan was made, a title-secure lender made an additional loan to borrower who had an
outstanding title-secured loan within the preceding 115 days, and security was not released.

        Illinois Title Loans, Inc., Title Loans of America, 2950 South MacArthur Boulevard,
Springfield – CILA License (1771) fined $5,075 for the following violations: Licensed location
was not maintaining posted hours, the loan register or transaction register was not properly
maintained, licensee did not disclose on delinquency notices for title-secured loans the
availability of debt management information at DFI’s toll-free number, the title secured loan
agreement did not contain a separate instrument signed by the borrower that he/she has not had
an outstanding title-secured loan in the last 15 days, title-secured lender did not obtain
borrower’s appropriate or most recent income documentation available at the time the loan was
made, licensee did not give written notice of intended sale/disposition of repossessed collateral
including all required information, repossession file did not contain a copy of the condition of
collateral at time of repossession, and the title-secured lender took possession of the vehicle
without sufficient prior written notice to the borrower that included the borrower’s right to make
the vehicle available to the lender and obtain personal belongings without additional charge.

        Illinois Title Loans, Inc., Title Loans of America, 1920 North Milwaukee Avenue,
Chicago – CILA License (1955) fined $2,050 for the following violations: Documentation was
not in file to indicate lien was released and title returned to the obligor on title-secured loan
                                               -4-
within 24 hours or 5 days if paid by check, title-secured lender did not obtain borrower’s
appropriate or most recent income documentation available at the time the loan was made, and
licensee did not deliver or mail to the borrower an affidavit of defense.

        Illinois Title Loans, Inc., Title Loans of America, 3159 West Cermak Avenue,
Chicago – CILA License (1781) fined $1,000 for failure to obtain any official documentation of
the borrower’s income before making a pay-day or title secured loan.

       Illinois Title Loans, Inc., Title Loans of America, 3113 Broadway, Mount Vernon –
CILA License (2124) fined $1,000 for making an additional loan to a borrower who had an
outstanding title-secured loan within the preceding 15 days.

         Title Cash of Illinois, Inc., d/b/a Cash-2-Go, 2935 Clearlake Avenue, Suite 2A,
Springfield – CILA License (2749) fined $1,150 for the following violations: Licensee did not
disclose on delinquency notices for title-secured loans the availability of debt management
information at DFI’s toll-free number, make, model, year and VIN of automobile was not on the
title-secured loan document, documentation was not in file to indicate lien was released and title
returned to the obligor on title-secured loan within 24 hours or 5 days if paid by check, and title-
secured lender did not obtain borrower’s appropriate or most recent income documentation
available at the time the loan was made.

         Title Cash of Illinois, Inc., d/b/a Cash-2-Go, 1300 East Washington Street, East
Peoria – CILA License (2095) fined $1,100 for the following violations: Documentation was not
in file to indicate lien was released and title returned to the obligor on title-secured loan within
24 hours or 5 days if paid by check, title-secured lender did not obtain borrower’s appropriate or
most recent income documentation available at the time the loan was made, licensee did not send
borrower a Notice of Right to Redeem with all required information, and licensee did not deliver
or mail to the borrower an affidavit of defense.

       Title Lenders, Inc., d/b/a USA Payday Loans, 1845 Broadway, Quincy – CILA
License (2158) fined $5,000 for the following violations: Lender made a title-secured loan with a
scheduled monthly payment exceeding 50% of the obligor’s gross monthly income and title-
secured lender did not obtain borrower’s appropriate or most recent income documentation
available at the time the loan was made.

       Title Lenders, Inc., d/b/a USA Payday Loans, 8127 South Cicero, Chicago – CILA
License (2201) fined $1,050 for the following violations: The annual percentage rate was not
accurately disclosed and the lender did not provide the borrower with written verification of the
cash proceeds of the loan on a title-secured loan or payday loan.

        The Payday Loan Store of Illinois, Inc., 1828 Dempster, Evanston – CILA License
(2121) fined $3,500 for the following violations: The payment receipt did not accurately show
the required elements, the title-secured loan agreement did not prominently display DFI’s
address and phone number and advise the borrower of the right to report lending and collection
violations, lender made a title-secured loan with a scheduled monthly payment exceeding 50% of
the obligor’s gross monthly income, and title-secured lender did not obtain borrower’s
appropriate or most recent income documentation available at the time the loan was made,

       Titlemax of Illinois, 803 East Ogden Avenue, Naperville - CILA License (3306) fined
$1,000 for failure to obtain borrower’s appropriate or most recent income documentation
available at the time the loan was made.
                                               -5-
       Titlemax of Illinois, 2633 Northtown Way, Highland - CILA License (3305) fined
$1,000 for failure to verify that the loan was permissible.
