                                                            - 15 -
Illinois Department of Financial and
Professional Regulation
                                                               NEWS
   SPRINGFIELD - The Illinois Department of Financial and Professional Regulation (IDFPR)
   announced today that directors of Professional Regulation, Daniel E. Bluthardt; Financial Institutions,
   Robert Meza; and Banking, Jorge A. Solis signed the following disciplinary orders in the month of
   October 2009.

                                              Banking

                                       BANKS AND TRUSTS

          Bank of Illinois, Normal – ordered to cease and desist from engaging in unsafe and unsound
   banking practices effective October 5, 2009.

          Benchmark Bank, Aurora-– ordered to cease and desist from engaging in unsafe and unsound
   banking practices effective October 25, 2009.

          Citizens Bank and Trust Company of Chicago, Chicago – ordered to cease and desist from
   engaging in unsafe and unsound banking practices effective October 9, 2009.

           Citizens First State Bank of Walnut, Walnut – written agreement signed to improve the
   business practices of the bank effective October 29, 2009.

          Community Bank of Lemont, Lemont – Division of Banking took possession and control of
   bank on October 30, 2009 for the purpose of receivership.

         First DuPage Bank, Westmont – Division of Banking took possession and control of bank on
   October 23, 2009 for the purpose of receivership.

          Lincoln Park Savings Bank, Chicago – ordered to cease and desist from engaging in unsafe
   and unsound banking practices effective October 16, 2009.

          Palos Bank and Trust Company, Palos Heights - ordered to cease and desist from engaging in
   unsafe and unsound banking practices effective October 12, 2009.

         United Fidelity Group Inc., San Diego, California – ordered to cease and desist using bank’s
   name without permission effective October 5, 2009.


                                                  -1-
                                     MORTGAGE BANKS


      AAXA Discount Mortgage, Wilmington, NC – residential mortgage license
(MB.6759145) was fined $10,000 for unregistered loan originator activity found in examination.

      America’s Pride Home Loan Corporation, Itasca – residential mortgage license
(MB.6760388) was fined $500 for loan disclosure violations found in examination.

      Amtec Funding Group, LLC, Costa Mesa, CA – residential mortgage license
(MB.6760057) was fined $5,000 for unregistered loan originator activity found in examination.

      Central Home Mortgage Corp., Lincolnwood – residential mortgage license
(MB.0005275) was revoked for failure to comply with Director’s suspension order.

      Charter Mortgage Services, Inc., Bloomingdale – residential mortgage license
(MB.0006429) was fined $5,000 for unregistered loan originator activity found in examination.

       Country Mortgage Services, Inc., Arlington Heights – residential mortgage license
(MB.0004727) was revoked for failure to properly renew or surrender the license and pay an
outstanding exam fee.

       Equity Mortgage Corporation, Lombard – residential mortgage license (MB.0000211)
revoked for failure to properly renew or surrender the license and pay an outstanding exam fee
(hearing requested).

       Forum Mortgage Bancorp, Chicago – residential mortgage license (MB.0004433) was
fined $10,000 for unregistered loan originator activity and failure to document loan originator
continuing education found in examination.

       International Mortgage Corp., Burr Ridge – residential mortgage license
(MB.6759506) revoked for failure to permit examination and maintain records and for failure to
properly surrender the license.

(MB.0002063) was fined $500 for advertising violations.

license (MB.6759629) was fined $3,000 for loan originator registration and advertising
violations.

continuing education found in examination.

                                                   -3-
                                    Financial Institutions
                               CONSUMER CREDIT SECTION


       A-1 Cash Loans, Inc., 202 South Eldorado Road, Unit 1-C, Bloomington – CILA
Licensee (1807) fined $3,750 for the following violations: Incomplete, incorrect, or improper
disclosure of itemization of amount financed, and loan contract did not accurately disclose the
schedule of payments or the total of payments.

        America’s Financial Choice, Inc., 799 South Washington, DuQuoin – CILA Licensee
(3169) fined $5,050 for the following violations: Lender did not input accurate information into
the database to determine if the obligor was eligible for a loan, security is not properly disclosed,
and annual percentage rate was not accurately disclosed.

       America’s Financial Choice, Inc., 1107 Sibley Boulevard, Dolton – CILA Licensee
(2830) fined $2,400 for the following violations: Incomplete, incorrect or improper disclosure of
itemization of amount financed, loan contract does not accurately disclose the schedule of
payments or the total of payments, security not properly disclosed, loan document or other legal
instrument contains blanks, annual percentage rate is not accurately disclosed.

       America’s Financial Choice, Inc., 1214 East Main Street, Olney – CILA Licensee
(2872) fined $2,100 for the following violations: Title-secured lender did not obtain borrower’s
appropriate or most recent income documentation available at the time the loan was made, lender
took security other than the vehicle title on a title-secured loan, makes title-secured loans but did
not have a supply of the pamphlets describing the availability of debt management services and
the obligor’s rights and responsibilities, location did not prominently display the license or
renewal certificate, applicable to licensee’s operating procedures Keys are retained by the lender
on the title-secured loan or motor vehicle retain contract but it is not provided for in the loan
contract, title-secured loan agreement does not prominently disclose DFI’s address and phone
number and advise the borrower of the right to report lending and collection violations, title-
secured loan agreement does not contain a separate statement signed by the borrower that he/she
has not had an outstanding title-secured loan in the past 15 days, licensee did not disclose on
delinquency notices for title-secured loans the availability of debt management information at
DFI’s toll-free number, and title-secured loan or refinancing agreement did not contain the
required initialed statement providing DFI’s toll-free number to call for Debt Management
Service information.

       America’s Financial Choice, Inc., 570 West Roosevelt Road, Chicago – CILA
Licensee (2292) fined $1,650 for the following violations: Lender was charging improper,
excessive, or undisclosed late payment fees, security was not properly disclosed, improper
simple interest calculations, and annual percentage rate was not accurately disclosed.

       America’s Financial Choice, Inc., 1107 Sibley Boulevard, Dolton – PLRA Licensee
(1285) fined $1,000 for failure to obtain any official documentation of the borrower’s income
before making a payday or title-secured loan.




                                                -4-
       American General Financial Services of Illinois, Inc., 430 75th Street, Downers
Grove – CILA Licensee (109) fined $1,650 for the following violations: Security was not
properly disclosed and loan document or other legal instrument contains blanks.

      Brother Loan & Finance Company, 1726 North Sheridan Road, North Chicago -
CILA Licensee (1189) fined $10,000 for failure to contain evidence of a contract signed or
acknowledged by the borrower in the file.

       CAR Financial Services, Inc., 701 Canyon, Suite 110, Coppell, TX – SFA Licensee
(1186) fined $2,100 for improper simple interest calculations.

        Check Into Cash of Illinois, LLC d/b/a Check Into Cash, 2378 172nd Street, Lansing
– CILA Licensee (1818) fined $1,900 for the following violations: File did not contain evidence
of a contract signed or acknowledged by the borrower and file of original papers for the loan was
not properly maintained.

       Chrysler Financial Services Americas, LLC, 27777 Inkster Road, Farmington Hills,
MI – SFA Licensee (1007) fined $4,650 for the following violations: Security not released,
evidence of a signed or acknowledged TILA Disclosure was not in the file of original papers,
and licensee did not obtain Director’s approval to maintain loan documents in a format or
medium other than original documents or paper.

        Community Financial Loan Company, Inc. d/b/a Speedy Loan, 2850 Belvidere
Road, Waukegan – PLRA Licensee (1493) fined $1,700 for the following violations: Loans
over 25% of borrower’s income, lender made a payday loan resulting in the borrower having
combined outstanding payday loan principal balances greater than 25% of borrower’s gross
monthly income, lender did not provide the required notice of the consumer’s right to a
repayment plan in a separate signed, written document, and lender did not enter into the database
that the borrower’s loan was paid in full or cancelled on the day the transaction was made.

        Easy Money Express Co. 1115B North Carbon, Marion – CILA Licensee (2265) fined
$15,800 for the following violations: Licensee did not obtain borrower’s appropriate or most
recent income documentation available at the time the loan was made, made a title-secured loan
with a scheduled monthly payment exceeding 50% of he obligor’s gross monthly income, the
principal amount of the new title-secured loan exceeded the total outstanding balance of the
refinanced loan, lender took security other than the vehicle title on a title-secured loan, title-
secured loan agreement did not prominently disclose DFI’s address and phone number and
advise the borrower of the right to report lending and collection violations, title-secured loan
agreement did not contain a separate statement signed by the borrower that he/she has not had an
outstanding title-secured loan in the last 15 days, licensee did not disclose on delinquency
notices for title-secured loans the availability of debt management information at DFI’s toll-free
number, and title-secured loan or refinancing agreement did not contain the required initialed
statement providing DFI’s toll-free number to call for Debt Management Service information.




                                              -5-
       Fiat Financial Money Center, LLC, 109 East Lake Street, Bartlett – PLRA Licensee
(1503) fined $,2350 for the following violations: Official income documentation was not the
required type for a payday loan or was not for income for the 30 days preceding the loan, loans
over 25% of borrower’s income, lender made a payday loan resulting in the borrower having
combined outstanding payday loan principal balances greater than 25% of borrower’s gross
monthly income, and licensee did not properly maintain loan records for two years after final
entry.

        GMAC LLC d/b/a GMAC Financial Services, LLC, 15303 South 94th Avenue,
Orland Park – SFA Licensee (1191) fined $4,550 for the following violations: Executed copy
of paid contract or other legal document retained in file but not stamped “PAID IN FULL” or
equivalent, security was not released, and a legal instrument taken in connection with the loan
did not bear the loan/transaction number.

       Greater Suburban Acceptance Corporation, 1645 West Ogden Avenue, Downers
Grove – SFA Licensee (489) fined $7,800 for the following violations: Security not released,
TILA box was not properly completed, evidence of a signed or acknowledged TILA Disclosure
was not in the file of original papers, security not properly disclosed, loan contract did not
accurately disclose date of the loan, and loan document or other legal instrument contains blanks.

       Household Finance Corporation III, 3035 South Dirkson Parkway, Capital City
Shopping Center, Springfield – CILA License (722) fined $1,500 for the following violations:
File does not contain evidence of a contract signed or acknowledged by the borrower, files did
not contain the security agreement, payment was not applied first to accumulated interest and
then to unpaid principal balance, improper simple interest calculations, and licensee did not
properly maintain loan records for two years after final entry.

       Illinois Title Loans, Inc., 1605 North Knoxville Avenue, Peoria – PLRA Licensee
(1432) fined $4,150 for the following violations: Licensee did not properly update the state
database with the required information on the day the transaction or event occurred and lender
has engaged in subterfuge for the purpose of avoiding the Payday Loan Reform Act.

        Illinois Title Loans, Inc., 605 Vandalia Street, Collinsville – PLRA Licensee (1443)
fined $3,000 for engaging in unfair, deceptive or fraudulent practices in the making or collecting
of a payday loan.

       Illinois Title Loans, Inc., 15940 South Kedzie, Markham – PLRA Licensee (1433)
fined $1,450 for following violations: Security was not released, loans over 25% of borrower’s

payday loan principal balances greater than 25% of borrower’s gross monthly income, and loan
document or other legal instruments contain blanks.

       Illinois Title Loans, Inc., 1720 Plainfield Road, Crest Hill – PLRA Licensee (1406)

cancelled on the day the transaction was made.

       Illinois Title Loans, Inc., 1800 Broadway Quincy – PLRA Licensee (1425) fined

       One Iron Ventures, Inc. d/b/a First Cash Advance, 12601 South Western Avenue,

income documentation for a payday loan or was not for income for the 30 days preceding the
loan.

        QC Financial Services, Inc. d/b/a First Choice Loans, 1401 North Prospect Avenue,
Suite 3, Champaign – PLRA Licensee (1500) fined $1,250 for the following violations: Lender
has not made an effort to contact the database provider in an attempt to get the database
functioning, one or more of the notices required by this section are not conspicuously posted in
English and Spanish, lender did not have posted in one-inch type: “INTEREST-FREE
REPAYMENT PLAN: If you still owe on one or more payday loans after 35 days, you are
entitled to enter into a repayment plan. The repayment plan will give you at least 55 days to
repay…”, lender did not have posted in one-inch type “WARNING: This loan is not intended to
meet long-term financial needs. This loan should be used only to meet short-term cash needs.
The cost of your loan may be higher than loans offered by other…”, lender did not have posted
the schedule of all finance charges to be charged on loans with an example of the amounts that
would be charged on a $100 loan payable in 13 days and a $400 loan payable in 30 days, giving
the corresponding APR, and lender did not have a notice posted stating that the lender cannot use
the criminal process against a consumer to collect any payday loan.

       QC Financial Services, Inc., 1513 Sibley Boulevard, Calumet City – CILA Licensee
(3214) fined $1,000 for failure to contain evidence of a contract signed or acknowledged by the
borrower in the file.

     Safeway Corporation of Indiana, 2251 East U.S. Highway 36, Suite 710, Avon, IN –
SFA Licensee (996) fined $3,150 for the following violations: Licensee did not maintain a
                                          -7-
positive net worth of a minimum of $30,000, applicable to licensee’s operating procedures
licensee did not follow required procedures when ceasing operations, closing business or filing
for bankruptcy, and applicable to licensee’s operating procedures licensee moved without 10
days notice or the applicable preapproval from the Director.

        The Payday Loan Store of Illinois, Inc., 8026 South Cicero Avenue, Burbank -

lender did not input accurate information into the database to determine if the obligor was

       The Payday Loan Store of Illinois, Inc., 10354 West Roosevelt Road, Westchester -
PLRA Licensee (1314) fined $3,725 for the following violations: Loans over 25% of borrower’s
income. Lender made a payday loan resulting in the borrower having combined outstanding

not obtain any official documentation of the borrower’s income before making a payday or title-
secured loan, lender did not enter into the database that the borrower’s loan was paid in full or
cancelled on the day the transaction was made, evidence of a signed or acknowledged TILA
Disclosure was not in the file of original papers, and licensee did not properly maintain loan
records for two years after final entry the file of original papers for the loan was not properly
maintained.

       The Payday Loan Store of Illinois, Inc., 1900 West Roosevelt Road, Broadview –
PLRA Licensee (1333) fined $2,275 for the following violations: Executed copy of paid
contract or other legal document retained in file but not stamped “PAID IN FULL” or equivalent,
wage assignment was accepted from borrower that contained blank spaces, loans over 25% of
borrower’s income, lender made a payday loan resulting in the borrower having combined
outstanding payday loan principal balances greater than 25% of borrower’s gross monthly
income, did not enter into the database that the borrower’s loan was paid in full or cancelled on
the day the transaction was made, did not input accurate information into the database to
determine if the obligor was eligible for a loan, original documents, or approved equivalent, not
cancelled or returned following payoff, and licensee did not properly maintain loan records for
two years after final entry.

        The Payday Loan Store of Illinois, Inc., 810 Front Street, Unit D, McHenry – CILA
Licensee (2927) fined $1,150 for file the following violations: Improper simple interest
calculations and the annual percentage rate were not accurately disclosed.

      The Payday Loan Store of Illinois, Inc., 17 W 625 Roosevelt Road, Oak Brook
Terrace – CILA Licensee (2886) fined $1,000 for improper simple interest calculations.

       Title Cash of Illinois, Inc., d/b/a Cash-2-Go, 2010 West Springfield Avenue,
Champaign – CILA Licensee (2845) fined $1,700 for the following violations: Lender did not
obtain any official documentation of the borrower’s income before making a payday or title-
secured loan, improper simple interest calculations, loan document or other legal instrument
contains blanks, and annual percentage rate was not accurately disclosed.
                                              -8-
        Tri-State Financial Services, Inc., 1258 Burnham Avenue, Calumet City –
CILA Licensee (2912) fined $2,400 for the following violations: Payment receipt did not
accurately show the required elements and licensed location did not maintain a file of original
papers.

        U.S. Cash advance Illinois, LLC d/b/a The Loan Machine, 1315 East 87th Street,
Chicago – CILA Licensee (3259) fined $3,100 for the following violations: Annual Percentage
Rate and Finance charge in the TILA disclosure are not more conspicuous than the other items in
the disclosure, payment record for a simple interest loan did not show the amount and date of
each payment of principal and interest, the principal balance due, the date to which interest is
paid or itemize other charges collected, security was not properly disclosed, improper simple
interest calculations, and loan document or other legal instrument contains blanks.

                            CURRENCY EXCHANGE SECTION

       Harper Court Currency Exchange, Inc, 1371A E. 53rd Street, Chicago – Currency
Exchange License (3479) fined in the amount of $1,500.00 for failure to maintain the statutorily
required minimum net worth.

        159th & LaGrange Currency Exchange, Inc, 15898 S. LaGrange Road, Orland Park
– Currency Exchange License (3811) fined in the amount of $1,400.00 for failure to maintain the
statutorily required minimum net worth.

                                             - 21 -
Illinois Department of Financial and
Professional Regulation
                                                                 NEWS
   SPRINGFIELD - The Illinois Department of Financial and Professional Regulation (IDFPR)
   announced today that directors of Professional Regulation, Daniel E. Bluthardt; and Banking,
   Jorge A. Solis signed the following disciplinary orders in the month of November 2009.

                                             Banking

                                      BANKS AND TRUSTS


          American Heartland Bank and Trust, Sugar Grove – ordered to cease and desist from
   engaging in unsafe and unsound banking practices. effective November 9, 2009.

          American Metro Bank, Chicago – ordered to cease and desist from engaging in unsafe
   and unsound banking practices.

          Bank of Shorewood, Shorewood – ordered to cease and desist from engaging in unsafe
   and unsound banking practices.

         Edgebrook Bank, Chicago – ordered to cease and desist from engaging in unsafe and
   unsound banking practices.

          Heritage Bank of Central Illinois, Trivoli – ordered to cease and desist from engaging
   in unsafe and unsound banking practices.

         Walker Law Group, Orange, California – ordered to cease and desist using bank’s
   name without permission.


                            RESIDENTIAL MORTGAGE LENDERS

          American Home Mortgage Lenders, Inc., d/b/a Veterans Mortgage, West Dundee –
   residential mortgage license (MB.6759217) revocation rescinded per Consent Order.

          Assured Home Mortgage Group, LTD, Cicero – residential mortgage license
   (MB.0005325) suspended and fined $5,000 for failure to respond to Department’s supervisory
   requests.


                                                -1-
       D R Funding of Illinois, Inc., Wheeling – residential mortgage license (MB.0006323)
fined $500 for a repeat exam violation and other violations found in examination.

       Equity Mortgage Group, Inc., Chicago – residential mortgage license (MB.0004897)
fined $500 for a repeat exam violation and other violations found in examination.

       Equity Consultants, LLC, Richfield, OH – residential mortgage license (MB.6759596)
revoked for failure to renew or properly surrender its license.

      GMC Mortgage Corporation, Rockville, NY – residential mortgage license
(MB.6760337) revoked for failure to renew or properly surrender its license.

        HCI Mortgage, Lake Ariel, PA – residential mortgage license (MB.0006150) revoked
for failure to renew or properly surrender its license.

      Integrity Mortgage Corporation, Schaumburg – residential mortgage license
(MB.0005373) fined $500 for a repeat exam violation and other violations found in examination.

      Lime Financial Services, LTD, Lake Oswego, OR – residential mortgage license
(MB.6759701) revoked for failure to renew or properly surrender its license.

         Professional Mortgage, Inc., Chicago – residential mortgage license (MB.6759353)
revoked and fined $20,000 for failure to notify the Department and report changes in business
activities and continue to operate regulated activities after expiration of license.

        Terwin Advisors, LLC, d/b/a Streamline Direct Mortgage, New York, NY –
residential mortgage license (MB.0006877) revoked for failure to renew or properly surrender its
license.

      The Prudential Home Mortgage Co., Lombard – residential mortgage license
(MB.0005743) revoked for failure to renew or properly surrender its license.

       UMC Mortgage Company, Johnston, RI – residential mortgage license (MB.6759547)
revoked for failure to renew or properly surrender its license.

        USA Homes Loans, Towson, MD – residential mortgage license (MB.6760515) revoked
for failure to renew or properly surrender its license.

        Victoria Financial Mortgage Corporation, Chicago – residential mortgage license
(MB.0006484) revoked for failure to renew or properly surrender its license and report changes
in business activities.

      World Alliance Financial, d/b/a Senior Lending Network, Melville, NY – residential
mortgage license (MB.0005969) fined $5,000 for loan originator registration violations found in
examination.




                                              -2-
                                    LOAN ORIGINATOR
        Janie Jakaitis, Chicago – LO license (031.0026909) fined $1,000 for conducting loan
origination activities without being registered.
       Lilia Lluvia, Chicago – LO license (031.0012360) revoked and fined $5,000 for
dishonest dealings.
        James A. Scheffler, Naperville – LO license (031.0003208) fined $5,000 for conducting
loan origination activities without being registered.



                                 Professional Regulation

                                       ACCOUNTANT

        Gerald Costin, Palos Heights – certified public accountant license (065-014779)
indefinitely suspended and fined $12,500 for failure to complete a tax and accounting
engagement for a client, failure to respond to the Department request for a response and
practiced with an expired license.

       Paul Matik, Chicago – certified public accountant license (065-020648) indefinitely
suspended and fined $5,000 for conviction of computer fraud.

       Leslie Rubin, Northbrook – certified public accountant license (065-008651) restored
with reprimand and fined $1,000.

       Babatunde Lawal, Aurora – registered certified public accountant license (239-013747)
placed in refuse to renew status for being more than 30 days delinquent in the payment of child
support.

        Dino Analitis, Des Plaines – (unlicensed) ordered to cease and desist the unlicensed
practice or holding out to the public as a certified public accountant.


         BARBER, COSMETOLOGY, ESTHETICS AND NAIL TECHNOLOGY

        Dennis Jethroe, Swansea – barber license (006-061830) placed in refuse to renew status
for being more than 30 days delinquent in the payment of child support.

       Ronald Wheeler, Chicago – barber license (006-app2900635) issued on indefinite
suspension for a minimum of six months due to unprofessional conduct.

       Kristin Baker, Lincoln – cosmetologist license (011-275078) placed on indefinite
probation after defaulted on an Illinois educational loan and has now entered into a repayment
agreement.

        Araceli Ciriaco, Waukegan – cosmetologist license (011-287366) issued on suspension
for 30 days due to material misstatement to the Department.

                                              -3-
        Brandi Dennis, Decatur – cosmetologist license (011-287528) issued and placed on
indefinite probation for a minimum of two years due to a felony conviction and unprofessional
conduct.

       Tammy Lloyd, Richton Park – cosmetologist license (011-233774) restored with
reprimand and fined $500 for failure to submit continuing education hours within the required
timeframe.

        Brenda Miller, Mt. Vernon – cosmetologist license (011-136538) reprimanded and
fined $500 for operating a salon prior to registration, providing services while license had lapsed
and allowing another to work at the salon on a lapsed license.

        Lonnell Poole, Harvey – cosmetologist license (011-app2846285) issued then
indefinitely suspended for a minimum of six months for convictions of armed violence and two
counts of aggravated criminal sexual assault.

       Jessica Semeraro, Elburn – cosmetologist license (011-271684) placed on indefinite
probation after defaulted on an Illinois educational loan and has now entered into a repayment
agreement.

        Edward Steinbeigle, Algonquin – cosmetologist license (011-226216) placed on
indefinite probation for a minimum of three years due to felony conviction and unprofessional
conduct.

       Jonathan Washington, Crete – cosmetologist license (011-278361) indefinitely
suspended due to a recent criminal conviction of attempted battery of a police officer.

        Sheila Becker, Walnut Creek, CA – esthetician license (131-002905) placed on
indefinite probation after defaulted on an Illinois educational loan and has now entered into a
repayment agreement.

       Lisa Herring, Chicago – nail technician license (169-019129) placed on indefinite
probation for a minimum of two years due to violation of probation and unprofessional conduct.

        Truong Nguyen, Homewood – nail technician license (169-018445) placed on probation
for one year for aiding and assisting unlicensed practice and unprofessional conduct.

       Lee Nails, Downers Grove – nail salon license (189-008382) reprimanded and fined
$1,000 for aiding and assisting unlicensed practice and unprofessional conduct.

       Edward Shin, Chicago – (unlicensed) ordered to cease and desist the unlicensed practice
of barbering, cosmetology, esthetics and/or nail technology.

        Charles Patterson, Northfield – dental controlled substance license (319-014358)

        Harmohinder Ahluwalia, Davenport, IA – veterinarian license (090-005154) placed in

        Gordon Iverson, Capron – veterinarian license (090-001839) reprimanded due to

medicine for working while license was in a non-renewed status.


                           WHOLESALE DRUG DISTRIBUTORS

       Cardinal Health, St. Charles, MO – wholesale drug distributor license (004-001605)
reprimanded and fined $10,000 for having delivered controlled substances to two Illinois
pharmacies after said pharmacies' Illinois controlled substance licenses had expired.

        Pharma Bio, Inc., Orland Park – wholesale drug distributor license (004-000558)
license reprimanded and fined $30,000 after operated for a period without the benefit of
licensure, operated for a period without an adequate facility and operated for a period beyond the
scope of its license.

       Richie Pharmacal Co., Inc., Glasgow, KY – wholesale drug distributor license (004-
00518) restored on indefinite probation and fined $1,000 after being disciplined in the
Commonwealth of Kentucky.

                                              - 14 -
Illinois Department of Financial and
Professional Regulation
                                                                  NEWS
           SPRINGFIELD - The Illinois Department of Financial and Professional Regulation
   (IDFPR) announced today that Directors of Professional Regulation, Daniel E. Bluthardt;
   Financial Institutions, Robert Meza; and Banking, Jorge A. Solis signed the following
   disciplinary orders in the month of December 2009.


                                              Banking

                                       BANKS AND TRUSTS

         Benchmark Bank, Aurora – Division of Banking took possession and control of bank
   on December 4, 2009 for the purpose of receivership.

           Centrue Bank, Streator – written agreement to improve the business practices of the
   bank.

          Clear Choice Financial Services, Boca Raton, FL – ordered to cease and desist using
   bank’s name without permission.

          I.F.D.A. Services, Inc., Springfield – order rescinding the Divisions prior order
   prohibiting the release of funds.

           Independent Bankers’ Bank, Springfield – Division of Banking took possession and
   control of bank on December 18, 2009 for the purpose of receivership.

          Midwest Bank and Trust Company, Elmwood Park – written agreement to improve
   the business practices of the bank.

         Wheatland Bank, Naperville – ordered to cease and desist from engaging in unsafe and
   unsound banking practices.


                                              THRIFTS

          George Washington Savings Bank, Orland Park – ordered to cease and desist from
   engaging in unsafe and unsound banking practices.




                                                   1
                                     RESIDENTIAL MORTGAGE

       Alwayslending, LLC, Ballwin, MO – orderd to cease and desist from conducting
unlicensed mortgage and branch office activities and fined $25,000.

      Clear Choice Financial Group, Inc., Roscoe – residential mortgage license
(MB.6759363) fined $700 for violations found in the Residential Real Property Disclosure Act.

         Freedom Mortgage Team, Inc., Chicago – residential mortgage license (MB.0006074)
revoked for failure to renew or properly surrender its license, failure to correct violations and pay
its fine in prior order, failure to pay its examination fee, and failure to comply with the
Department.

      Interbank Mortgage Company, Northbrook – residential mortgage license
(MB.0006421) fined $5,000 per Consent Order.

      Janan Mortgage Corporation, Loves Park – residential mortgage license
(MB.6759586) fine was removed per Consent Order.

       Kase Mortgage Banc, Inc., Elgin – residential mortgage license (MB.6760481) fined
$15,000 due to unlicensed branch activities, improper advertising and maintenance of loan
records, and failure to comply with the Department.

       Lend America, Melville, NY – residential mortgage license (MB.6759907) revoked and
fined $25,000 for failure to close and fund borrowers’ loans, and comply with the Department.

       Primary Mortgage Corporation, Lansing – residential mortgage license (MB.6759269)
fine was reduced to $1,500 per Consent Order.

      Seniors Reverse Mortgage, Inc., Pleasant Hill, CA – residential mortgage license
(MB.6760610) fined $5,000 due to improper branch office arrangements.

       Strategic Lending, Inc., St. Louis, MO – ordered to cease and desist from conducting
unlicensed mortgage and unregistered loan originator activities and fined $25,000. (Under
Appeal)

        Superior Home Loans, LLC, Belleville – residential mortgage license (MB.0006048)
suspended for 180 days and fined $50,000 for improper co-brokering activities, unregistered loan
originator activities, and improper records maintenance. (Under Appeal)

       Unibanc Mortgage Corporation, Aurora – residential mortgage license (MB.0005806)
fined $5,000 for repeat violations found in examination.

        Waterstone Mortgage Corp., Pewaukee, WI – residential mortgage license
(MB.6760383) fined $75,000 per Consent Order for unlicensed branch office activities and
violations found in examination.

                                     LOAN ORIGINATORS

        Paul Barton, Belleville – ordered to cease and desist from performing loan originator

$10,000 for initiating a co-brokering scheme. (This order is currently under appeal)

        Douglas Gool, Belleville – ordered to cease and desist from performing loan originator
activities without a loan originator registration and fined for $2,500.

        Glen Hayhurst, St. Louis, MO – ordered to cease and desist from performing loan
originator activities without a loan originator registration and fined for $2,500. (This order is
currently under appeal)

        Sam Hood, Swansea – ordered to cease and desist from performing loan originator
activities without a loan originator registration and fined $2,500.

       Drina L. Martinez, Carpentersville – LO license (031.0011539) suspended for 180
days and fined $10,000 for running an unlicensed branch.
        Jose Minero, Melrose Park – LO license (031.0022438) suspended for 60 days and
fined $10,000 for using the name and registration of another loan originator on a loan application
in order to close the loan.
        Maria Padilla, Chicago – LO license (031.0014757) suspended for 90 days and fined
$5,000 for allowing another loan originator to use her name and registration to close a loan. (This
order is currently under appeal)
        Joshua D. Phelps, Waterloo – LO license (031.0003488) suspended for 180 days and
fined $10,000 for allowing other loan originator to use his name and registration to close loans
and for participating in a co-brokering scheme. (This order is currently under appeal)
        Marcus Renken, Alton – LO license (031.0011972) suspended for 90 days and fined
$5,000 for using the name and registration of another loan originator on a loan application in
order to close a loan and for participating in a co-brokering scheme. (This order is currently
under appeal)
        Daryl A. Stamper, East Alton – LO license (031.0017683) suspended for 90 days and
fined $5,000 for using the name and registration of another loan originator on loan applications
in order to close loans and for participating in a co-brokering scheme. (This order is currently
under appeal)
       Michael J. Throneberry, Edwardsville – LO license (031.0007721) revoked and fined
$5,000 for participating in a co-brokering scheme.




                                                -3-
                                  Financial Institutions
                     Note: If a licensee has exercised its right to a hearing
                    pursuant to statute, an order on this list may not be final.

                                     CONSUMER CREDIT

       America’s Financial Choice Inc., 1150 West Belmont Avenue, Chicago – PL license
(1286) fined $7,000 for the following violations: Lender did not obtain any official
documentation of the borrower’s income before making a payday or title-secured loan, lender
made a payday loan with a term less than 13 days long, and lender charged more than $15.50 per
$100 loaned on a payday loan.

         America’s Financial Choice, Inc., 3216 Broadway, Mount Vernon – CILA license
(3165) fined $1,625 for the following violations: Lender makes title-secured loans but did not
have a supply of the pamphlets describing the availability of debt management services and the
obligor’s rights and responsibilities, the title-secured loan or refinancing agreement did not
contain the required initialed statement providing DFI’s toll-free number to call for Debt
Management information, licensee did not disclose on delinquency notices for title-secured loans
the availability of debt management information at DFI’s toll-free number, the title-secured loan
agreement did not contain a separate statement signed by the borrower that he/she has not had an
outstanding title-secured loan in the last 15 days, the title-secured loan agreement does not
prominently disclose DFI’s address and phone number and advise the borrower of the right to
report lending and collection violations, the lender took security other than the vehicle title on a
title-secured loan, keys are retained by the lender on the title-secured loan or motor vehicle retail
contract, but is not provided for in the loan contract, and title-secured lender did not obtain
borrower’s most recent income documentation available at the time the loan was made.

       ASAP Cash Loans Inc., 461 North Lake Street, Mundelein – CILA license (2981)
fined $1,050 for failure to properly disclose security.

       Consumer Financial Services Corporation, 1596 North Farnsworth Avenue, Aurora
– CILA/SF license (2977) fined $1,200 for the following violations: The Loan contract did not
accurately disclose the date of the loan and failure to properly disclose security.

         Marathon Management Company, 1201 East 5th Street, Metropolis – CILA license
(2930) fined $8,400 for the following violations: Licensee did not maintain a positive net worth
of a minimum of $30,000, lender made a title-secured loan subject to Subpart B that was not
written on a simple-interest basis, the title-secured loan or refinancing agreement did not contain
the required initialed statement providing DFI’s toll-free number to call for Debt Management
Service information, the title-secured loan agreement did not contain a separate statement signed
by the borrower that he/she has not had an outstanding title-secured loan in the last 15 days, the
title-secured loan agreement did not prominently disclose DFI’s address and phone number and
advise the borrower of the right to report lending and collection violations, the lender took
security other than the vehicle title on a title-secured loan, the principal amount of the new title-
secured loan exceeded the total outstanding balance of the refinanced loan, lender made a title-
secured loan with a scheduled monthly payment exceeding 50% of the obligor’s gross monthly
income, title-secured lender did not obtain borrower’s most recent income documentation
available at the time the loan was made, and lender did not input accurate information into the
database to determine if the obligor was eligible for a loan.

                                              ###




                                             - 23 -
Illinois Department of Financial and
Professional Regulation
                                                                   NEWS
           SPRINGFIELD - The Illinois Department of Financial and Professional Regulation
   (IDFPR) announced today that directors of Professional Regulation, Daniel E. Bluthardt;
   Financial Institutions, Robert Meza; and Banking, Jorge A. Solis signed the following
   disciplinary orders in the month of January 2010.

                                       Division of Banking

                                       BANKS AND TRUSTS

          Town Community Bank and Trust, Antioch – ordered to cease and desist from
   engaging in unsafe and unsound banking practices.

          Town Community Bank and Trust, Antioch – Division of Banking took possession
   and control of bank on January 15, 2010 for the purpose of receivership.

         Broadway Bank, Chicago – ordered to cease and desist from engaging in unsafe and
   unsound banking practices.


                                      MORTGAGE BANKING

         Ace Mortgage Company, Inc., Lincolnwood – residential mortgage license
   (MB.0005271) revoked for failure to renew or properly surrender its license, failure to pay its
   examination fee, and failure to comply with the Department.

         Accurate Mortgage Corporation, Matteson – residential mortgage license
   (MB.0005732) revoked for failure to renew or properly surrender its license.

          American Nationwide Bancorp, Inc., West Chicago – residential mortgage license
   (MB.6760555) fined $25,000 for conducting unregistered loan originator activities and violations
   found in examination.

           First Choice Mortgage Corporation, Bloomingdale – residential mortgage license
   (MB.0005034) revoked and fined $20,000 in connection with a federal indictment for fraudulent
   loan originations and for failure to notify the Department.


                                                  -1-
       First Start Mortgage, Inc., Chicago – residential mortgage license (MB.0006412) fined

                                 Division of Financial Institutions
                     Note: If a licensee has exercised its right to a hearing
                    pursuant to statute, an order on this list may not be final.

                                Consumer Credit Section
        AAA Cash Advance, Inc., 19 Pullen Road, Metropolis - CILA License (1636) fined
$5,425 for the following violations: Improper simple interest calculations, license is
compounding interest or collecting interest in advance, the principal amount of the new title-
secured loan exceeded the total outstanding balance of the refinanced loan, title-secured lender
did not obtain borrower’s most recent income documentation available at the time loan was
made, lender did not input accurate information into the database to determine if the obligor was
eligible for a loan, lender did not enter into the database that the borrower’s loan was paid in full
or cancelled on the day the transaction was made, lender did not allow borrower’s partial
payments to be credited on the account record as of the date received, and improper accounting
of principal and interest payment.

        Advance, LLC, 150 East South Street, Suite H, Kewanee - CILA License (2742) fined
$2,200 for the following violations: The annual percentage rate was not accurately disclosed, the
lender took security other than the vehicle title on a title-secured loan, title-secured lender did not
obtain borrower’s most recent income documentation available at the time the loan was made,
and Security is not released.

        All American Cash Advance, Inc., 111 South Lincolnway, Suite B, North Aurora -
CILA License (2731) fined $1,775 for the following violations: The annual percentage rate is not
accurately disclosed, improper simple interest calculations, the loan contract did not accurately
disclose the schedule of payments or the total of payments, Lender made title-secured loans but
did not have a supply of the pamphlets describing the availability of debt management services
and the obligor’s rights and responsibilities, the title-secured loan or refinancing agreement did
not contain the required initialed statement providing DFI’s toll-free number to call for Debt
Management Service information, the title-secured loan agreement did not contain a separate
statement signed by the borrower that he/she has not had an outstanding title secured loan in the
last 15 days, the title-secured loan agreement did not prominently disclose DFI’s address and
phone number and advise the borrower of the right to report lending and collection violations,
and the lender took security other than the vehicle title on a title-secured loan.

(1279) fined $2,050 for the following violations: Lender did not verify that the loan was
permissible, lender did not enter into the database that the borrower’s loan was paid in full or

                                                 -2-
cancelled on the day the transaction was made, and licensee did not properly update the state
database with the required information on the day the transaction or event occurred.

$30,000.

initialed statement providing DFI’s toll-free number to call for Debt Management Service
Information, the title-secured loan agreement did not contain a separate statement signed by the
borrower that he/she has not had an outstanding title-secured loan in the last 15 days, the title-
secured loan agreement did not prominently disclose DFI’s address and phone number and
advise the borrower of the right to report lending and collection violations, lender did not have

within 24 hours or 5 days if paid by check, lender did not obtain any official documentation of

                                               - 20 -
Illinois Department of Financial and
Professional Regulation
                                                                   NEWS
           SPRINGFIELD - The Illinois Department of Financial and Professional Regulation
   (IDFPR) announced today that directors of Professional Regulation, Daniel E. Bluthardt;
   Financial Institutions, Robert Meza; and Banking, Jorge A. Solis signed the following
   disciplinary orders in the month of February 2010.


                                       Division of Banking

                                       BANKS AND TRUSTS

          American Enterprise Bank, Buffalo Grove – consent order to stop engaging in unsafe
   and unsound banking practices.

          Community First Bank – Chicago, Chicago – consent order to stop engaging in unsafe
   and unsound banking practices.

          Equity Loans, LLC, Atlanta, Georgia – ordered to cease and desist using bank’s name
   without permission.

         Flagship Mortgage Corporation, Elmhurst – ordered to cease and desist using bank’s
   name without permission.

          New Century Bank, Chicago – consent order to stop engaging in unsafe and unsound
   banking practices.


                                            PAWNSHOPS

           Delgado Jewelry, Joliet – ordered to cease and desist and levied a $765 civil penalty for
   practicing as a pawnshop without a license.

          More Money Gold & Pawn, Salem – levied a $1,000 civil penalty for disposing of
   deposited property.




                                                   1
                                           THRIFTS


       George Washington Savings Bank – Division of Banking took possession and control
of bank on February 19, 2010 for the purpose of receivership.


                                     MORTGAGE BANKS

       Hammer Financial Corp., Chicago – residential mortgage license (MB.0004621)
revoked and fined $50,000 for failure to comply with the Department.


                                   Financial Institutions

                    Note: If a licensee has exercised its right to a hearing
                   pursuant to statute, an order on this list may not be final.

                              CONSUMER CREDIT SECTION

       CAR Financial Services, Inc., 10770 Wateridge Circle, Suite 250, San Diego, CA –
SF License (1273) fined $3,550 for the following violations: The annual percentage rate was not
accurately disclosed, improper simple interest calculations, the loan contract did not accurately
disclose the schedule of payments of the total of payments, licensee did not dispose of collateral
within 90 days of repossession, repossession file did not indicate a statement of final accounting
containing the required information was sent to the borrower, and licensee purchased sales
finance contracts from seller using a contract, security instrument, or other document not in
conformance with the provisions of the Retail Installment/ Motor Vehicle Retail Installment
Sales Act or other State/Fed statutes.

        Cottonwood Financial Illinois, LLC, 1701 North Larkin Street, Suite 901, Crest Hill
– CILA License (3365) fined $4,225 for the following violations: Improper simple interest
calculations, the payment receipt did not accurately show the required elements, make, model,
year, and VIN of automobile were not on the title-secured loan document, lender made a title-
secured loan with a scheduled monthly payment exceeding 50% of the obligor’s gross monthly
income, lender did not input accurate information into the database to determine if the obligor
was eligible for a loan, and lender did not obtain any official documentation of the borrower’s
income before making a payday or title-secured loan.

        National Credit Lenders, LLC, 157 West 159th Avenue, Harvey – CILA License
(3467) fined $1,025 for the following violations: Licensed location was not maintaining posted
hours, licensed location did not prominently display the license or renewal certificate, the annual
percentage rate was not accurately disclosed, file did not contain promissory note in the file,
evidence of a signed or acknowledged Truth-In-Lending Disclosure was not in the file of original
papers, the loan contract did not accurately disclose the schedule of payments or the total of
payments, and licensee did not provide requested documents or information during the exam.




                                               -2-
        S&H Quick Cash Loans, 249 E. Indian Trail Road, Aurora - CILA License (3458)
fined $6,550 for the following violations: The annual percentage rate was not accurately
disclosed, improper simple interest calculations, the loan contract did not accurately disclose the
schedule of payments or the total of payments, and security was not released.

        The Payday Loan Store of Illinois, Inc., 3175 West 175th Street, Suite B, Hazel Crest
– CILA License (3459) fined $10,000 for the following violations: Improper simple interest
calculations, the payment receipt did not accurately show the required elements, the title-secured
loan agreement did not prominently disclose DFI’s address and phone number and advise the
borrower of the right to report lending and collection violations, title-secured lender did not
obtain borrower’s most recent income documentation available at the time the loan was made,
and lender did not obtain any official documentation of the borrower’s income before making a
payday or title-secured loan.

        Tri-State Financial Services, Inc., 15898 South LaGrange Road, Orland Park –
CILA License (3463) fined $4,000 for the following violations: Licensee did not maintain a
positive net worth of a minimum of $30,000, the title-secured loan agreement did not
prominently disclose DFI’s address and phone number and advise the borrower of the right to
report lending and collection violations, title-secured lender did not obtain borrower’s most
recent income documentation available at the time the loan was made, and lender did not input
accurate information into the database to determine if the obligor was eligible for a loan.

        Tri-State Financial Services, Inc., 1187 North Farnsworth Avenue, Suite 103,
Aurora – CILA License (3462) fined $9,100 for the following violations: The licensed location
did not maintain a file of original papers, the title-secured loan agreement did not contain a
separate statement signed by the borrower that he/she has not had an outstanding title-secured
loan in the last 15 days, the title-secured loan agreement did not prominently disclose DFI’s
address and phone number and advise the borrower of the right to report lending and collection
violations, lender made a title-secured loan with a scheduled monthly payment exceeding 50% of
the obligor’s gross monthly income, lender did not input accurate information into the database
to determine if the obligor was eligible for a loan, and lender did not obtain any official
documentation of the borrower’s income before making a payday or title-secured loan.


                                  CURRENCY EXCHANGE

       1st Currency Exchange of Decatur No. 2, Inc., 1659 Eldorado Street, Decatur –
Currency Exchange License (3803) fined in the amount of $1,075 for failure to have its license
posted and for check cashing rates over maximum permitted by statute.

                                                         DENTAL

       Przemyslaw Marchwiak, Chicago – dental license (019-024632) suspended for one

in refuse to renew status due to unlicensed practice and unprofessional conduct.

      Randall & Son Construction Inc., St. Charles – roofing contractor license (104-
005006) reprimanded and fined $500 due to unprofessional conduct.

       Mitchell Rhoads, Paris – roofing contractor license (104-011783) placed in refuse to
renew status for practicing without an active Illinois license.




                                               - 17 -
                                   SURGICAL ASSISTANT

        Julian Naumoff, Roselle – surgical assistant license (238-000095) indefinitely
suspended due to unprofessional conduct and willful filing of a false statement to induce
payment from several patients regarding the cost of surgical assistant services provided to the
patients.

                                  VETERINARY MEDICINE

       Paul Barrett, Scottsdale, AZ – veterinarian license (090-008769) reprimanded after
being disciplined in the state of Arizona for administering too high of a dose of medication.

        Ramabhadran Narayanan, Palos Hills – veterinarian license (090-008219) and
controlled substance license (390-003567) placed on probation for two years for failure to
maintain controlled substance reports.

        Mark Riordan, Marseilles – veterinarian license (090-007458) placed in refuse to renew
status due to a felony conviction for First Degree Child Molestation.

        Alexander Terdik, Island Lake – veterinarian license (090-004945) reprimanded for
failure to maintain proper records during care of a feline.

       Scott Norman, Princeville – (unlicensed) ordered to pay a $500 civil penalty for
unlicensed veterinary medicine practice.

                                              - 18 -
Illinois Department of Financial and
Professional Regulation
                                                                  NEWS
   SPRINGFIELD - The Illinois Department of Financial and Professional Regulation (IDFPR)
   announced today that directors of Professional Regulation, Daniel E. Bluthardt; Financial
   Institutions, Robert Meza; and Banking, Jorge A. Solis signed the following disciplinary orders
   in the month of March 2010.


                                       Division of Banking

                                       BANKS AND TRUSTS

         All American Bank, Des Plaines – consent order to stop engaging in unsafe and
   unsound banking practices.

         Bank of Illinois, Normal – Division of Banking took possession and control of bank on
   March 5, 2010 for the purpose of receivership.

           First Chicago Bank & Trust, Chicago – written agreement to improve the business
   practices of the bank.

          First United Bank, Crete – consent order to stop engaging in unsafe and unsound
   banking practices.

         First Personal Bank, Orland Park – consent order to stop engaging in unsafe and
   unsound banking practices.

         I.F.D.A., Springfield – amended order issued authorizing the withdrawal of funds by
   consumers.

          Kinderhook State Bank, Kinderhook – ordered to cease and desist from engaging in
   unsafe and unsound banking practices.

          ShoreBank, Chicago – amended an order to cease and desist from engaging in unsafe
   and unsound banking practices.

          USA Loan Auditors, Irvine, CA – ordered to cease and desist from using bank’s name
   without permission.


                                                 -1-
                                   LOAN ORIGINATOR


       Theodore Cardenas, Schaumburg – LO license (031.0015166) revoked and fined
$20,000 for participating in a mortgage fraud scheme.

        John Karapournos, Skokie – LO license (031.0019550) revoked and fined $20,000 for
participating in a mortgage fraud scheme.

        Razzak A. Khader, Morton Grove– LO license (031.007745) revoked and fined $20,000
for participating in a mortgage fraud scheme.

        Zarak Khan, Chicago – LO license (031.0013636) revoked and fined $20,000 for
participating in a mortgage fraud scheme. (This order is currently under appeal)

        Sara Mian, Niles – LO license (031.0016183) was fined $20,000 and Revoked for
participating in a mortgage fraud scheme.

        Jeffery Townsend, Niles – LO license (031.0009377) revoked and fined $20,000 for
participating in a mortgage fraud scheme.


                               RESIDENTIAL MORTGAGE

       1ST Alliance Banc Corporation, Chicago – residential mortgage license (MB.0006670)
fined $25,000 for conducting unregistered and improper loan originator activities and causing
financial injury to borrowers.

      AM Mortgage Corporation, Lincolnwood – residential mortgage license
(MB.0006411) revoked and fined $100,000 in connection with fraudulent mortgage activities.

      Atlas Preferred Mortgage, LLC, Chicago – residential mortgage license
(MB.6760306) revoked and fined $100,000 in connection with fraudulent mortgage activities.

      C.D.K. U.S.A. Mortgage, Chicago – residential mortgage license (MB.0004785) fined
$100,000 in connection with fraudulent mortgage activities.

       Country Mortgage Services, Arlington Heights – residential mortgage license
(MB.0004727) fined $100,000 in connection with fraudulent mortgage scheme and investigation.
(This Order is currently under Appeal)

         Eagle Mortgage & Consultants, Inc., Lansing – residential mortgage license
(MB.0004664) revoked for numerous violations of the Act and Rules cited in examination and
for failure to pay fines and fees due to the Department.

        Elite Financial Investments, Inc., Oak Brook – residential mortgage license
(MB.0006556) fined $25,000 in connection with improper recordkeeping and failure to comply
with the Department’s regulatory requests in investigating a mortgage fraud scheme. (This Order
is currently under Appeal)

       Arcola Homestead Savings Bank, Arcola – ordered to cease and desist from engaging
in unsafe and unsound banking practices.


                            Division of Financial Institutions

                    Note: If a licensee has exercised its right to a hearing
                   pursuant to statute, an order on this list may not be final.

                                    CONSUMER CREDIT

         A-All Financial Services, Inc., 7901 South Vincennes Avenue, Chicago – CILA
license (2988) fined $1,850 for the following violations: The title-secured loan or refinancing
agreement did not contain the required initialed statement providing DFI’s toll-free number to
call for Debt Management Service Information, the title-secured loan agreement did not contain
a separate statement signed by the borrower that he/she has not had an outstanding title-secured
loan in the last 15 days, lender did not enter into the database that the borrower’s loan was paid
in full or cancelled on the day the transaction was made, licensee did not properly update the
state database with the required information on the day the transaction or event occurred, and file
did not contain evidence of a contract signed or acknowledged by the borrower.

        Advance Cash Express, Inc., 401 East Riverside Boulevard, Loves Park - CILA
license (2210) fined $1,050 for failure to accurately disclose the annual percentage rate.

        Affinity Credit Services, Inc., 10272 South Harlem Avenue, Bridgeview – CILA
license (3131) fined $1,300 for the following fines: The annual percentage rate was not
accurately disclosed and improper simple interest calculations.

       American General Financial Services of Illinois, Inc., 2313 West 95th Street, Chicago
– CILA license (262) fined $1,150 for the following violations: Evidence of a signed or
acknowledged Truth-In-Lending Disclosure was not in the file of original papers and file did not
contain evidence of a contract signed or acknowledged by the borrower.




                                               -3-
        America’s Financial Choice, Inc., 221 Lake Land Boulevard, Mattoon – CILA
license (2831) fined $1,500 for the following violations: The annual percentage rate was not
accurately disclosed and the loan contract did not accurately disclose the schedule of payments
of the total of payments.

        America’s Financial Choice, Inc., 1150 West Belmont Avenue, Chicago – CILA
license (2072) fined $1,000 for failure to properly calculate simple interest.

        Check Into Cash of Illinois, LLC, 1002 Shooting Park, Peru – PL license (1234) fined
$4,850 for the following violations: The loan document or other legal instrument contained
blanks, lender did not input accurate information into the database to determine if the obligor
was eligible for a loan, and lender did not obtain any official documentation of the borrower’s
income before making a payday or title-secured loan.

        Chicago Finance Center, 3538 West Irving Park Road, Chicago – CILA license
(3470) fined $6,625 for the following violations: The licensee’s account record did not indicate
that the loan is hypothecated, licensed location did not prominently display the license or
renewal certificate, insurance business within the same building/entrance, light up signage for
insurance business at said address 3538 West Irving Park Rd., licensee maintains records off-site
without Director’s preapproval, the file of original papers for the loan was not properly
maintained, security was not properly disclosed, a separate and complete file was not kept for
judgments, foreclosures, repossessions, death claims and/or sales, and hypothecated notes did not
bear the endorsement required by this section.

        Chrysler Financial Services Americas, LLC, 901 Warrenville Road, Suite 500, Lisle
– SF license (1007) fined $10,900 for the following violations: The loan document or other legal
instrument contained blanks, the payment record did not show at pay-off all of the items required
by this section, licensee disposed of collateral during the redemption period, licensee did not
deliver or mail to the borrower an affidavit of defense, licensee did not give written notice of
intended sale/disposition of repossessed collateral including all required information,
repossession file did not contain signed receipts showing the collateral purchased, the amount
paid and the name of the obligor, the account record for a simple interest loan did not show the
original principal amount of the loan, rates of interest and/or the finance charge, file did not
contain evidence of a contract signed or acknowledged by the borrower, and security was not
released.

       CitiFinancial Services, Inc., 3502 East State Street, Rockford – CILA license (1026)
fined $4,000 for insufficient interest rebate.

       Citizens Finance Company, 7911 West 171st Street, Tinley Park – CILA license
(3027) fined $1,050 for the loan document or other legal instrument containing blanks, and
incomplete, incorrect or improper disclosure of itemization of amount financed.

        Cottonwood Financial Illinois, LLC, 3701 North Sterling Avenue, Peoria – CILA
license (3382) fined $2,550 for the following violations: Improper simple interest calculations,
interest rebate was insufficient, and title-secured lender did not obtain borrower’s most recent
income documentation available at the time the loan was made.



                                               -4-

license (3398) fined $5,600 for the following violations: The loan document or other legal

        Cottonwood Financial Illinois, LLC, 12547 State Rte. 143, Suite 102, Highland –

of the obligor’s gross monthly income, and lender did not input accurate information into the
database to determine if the obligor was eligible for a loan.

        Dollars Today, Inc., 3600 Broadway, Quincy – CILA license (2821) fined $3,800 for
the following violations: The loan document or other legal instrument contained blanks, security
was not properly disclosed, the loan contract did not accurately disclose the schedule of
payments or the total of payments, the title-secured loan agreement did not contain a separate
statement signed by the borrower that he/she has not had an outstanding title-secured loan in the
last 15 days, and the lender took security other than the vehicle title on a title-secured loan.

the database to determine if the obligor was eligible for a loan and lender did not obtain any
official documentation of the borrower’s income before making a payday or title-secured loan.

       Great Lakes Specialty Finance, Inc., 13217 South Cicero, Crestwood – PL license
(1132) fined $1,350 for the following violations: Lender did not obtain any official
documentation of the borrower’s income before making a payday or title-secured loan, lender did
not have a ready supply of payday loan pamphlets to provide to borrowers, and official income
documentation was not the required type for a payday loan or was not for income for the 30 days
preceding the loan.



                                               -5-
        Great Lakes Specialty Finance, Inc., 1401 West Market Street, Bloomington – PL

enter into the database that the borrower’s loan was paid in full or canceled on the day the
transaction was made, and official income documentation was not the required type for a payday

license (1094) fined $5,950 for the following violations: The loan document or other legal
instrument contained blanks, lender did not input accurate information into the database to
determine if the obligor was eligible for a loan, loans over 25% of borrower’s income, lender
made a payday loan resulting in the borrower having combined outstanding payday loan
principal balances greater than 25% of borrower’s gross monthly income, official income
documentation was not the required type for a payday loan or was not for income for the 30 days
preceding the loan, and the licensee has failed to comply with a provision of this Act or an order,
decision, finding, rule, regulation, or direction of the Director lawfully made pursuant to the
authority of this Act.

to determine if the obligor was eligible for a loan, and lender did not obtain any official
documentation of the borrower’s income before making a payday or title-secured loan.

paid in full or cancelled on the day the transaction was made, lender did not obtain any official
documentation of the borrower’s income before making a payday or title-secured loan, the lender
made a payday loan but there is no evidence of a signed, written agreement, a partial payment on
a PLRA loan or repayment plan was not entered into the database on the date the transaction was
made, and official income documentation was not the required type for a payday loan or was not
for income for the 30 days preceding the loan.

       Illinois Lending Corporation, 408 North Wells Street, Chicago – CILA license (1259)

cancelled or returned following payoff, licensee did not keep a separate, complete file for each
obligor, and licensee did not credit obligor’s account with the rebate received for unearned
premiums or contract charges and refund the account credit balance to the obligor.




                                               -6-
        Illinois Title Loans, Inc., 5201 West North Avenue, Chicago – CILA license (1916)
fined $3,300 for the following violations: The loan document or other legal instrument contained
blanks, title-secured lender did not obtain borrower’s most recent income documentation
available at the time the loan was made, licensee did not send borrower a Notice of the Right to
Redeem with all required information, licensee did not deliver or mail to the borrower an
affidavit of defense, date of repossession not available in the account record, licensee did not
give written notice of intended sale/disposition of repossessed collateral including all required
information, lender did not input accurate information into the database to determine if the

official documentation of the borrower’s income before making a payday or title-secured loan.

input information into the database which is required by the Department.

        QC Financial Services, Inc., 8202 South Stony Island Avenue, Chicago – CILA
license (2255) fined $7,850 for the following violations: Improper simple interest calculations,
security was not properly disclosed, lender made title-secured loans but did not have a supply of
the pamphlets describing the availability of debt management services and the obligor’s rights
and responsibilities, the title-secured loan or refinancing agreement did not contain a separate
statement signed by the borrower that he/she has not had an outstanding title-secured loan in the
last 15 days, title-secured loan agreement did not prominently disclose DFI’s address and phone
number and advise the borrower of the right to report lending and collection violations, make,
model, year, and VIN of automobile are not on the title-secured loan document, title-secured
loan was not fully amortized or was not repayable in substantially equal installments, and
executed copy of paid contract or other legal document retained in file but not stamped “PAID
IN FULL” or equivalent.

        Short Term Loans, LLC, 1227 Glen Ellyn Road, Glendale Heights – CILA license
(1897) fined $3,875 for the following violations: The loan document or other legal instrument
contained blanks, licensee refinanced or renewed a title-secured loan within 15 days after the
maturity date of the loan, title-secured lender did not obtain borrower’s most recent income
documentation available at the time the loan was made, lender did not input accurate information
into the database to determine if the obligor was eligible for a loan, and licensee did not properly
update the state database with the required information on the day the transaction or event
occurred.

secured loans but did not have a supply of the pamphlets describing the availability of debt
management services and the obligor’s rights and responsibilities, lender made a title-secured


                                                -7-
loan subject to Subpart B that was not written on a simple-interest basis, the title-secured loan or

information into the database to determine if the obligor was eligible for a loan.

                                                -8-
borrower of the right to report lending and collection violations, the lender did not provide the

probation for a minimum of five years after diverted controlled substances from his former
pharmacy employer for self-use.

        Jennifer Zegar, Berwyn – pharmacist license (051-287833) automatically and
indefinitely suspended for a minimum of six months for violating a consent order with the
Department by testing positive for cocaine.

       Nicholas Zener, Deerfield – pharmacist license (051-293112) placed on indefinite
probation for a minimum of five years after diverted controlled substances from his former
pharmacy employer for self-use.

        Bolingbrook Pharmacy, Bolingbrook – pharmacy license (054-005594) placed on
probation for one year and fined $2,800 and Bernard Bonkalski, Naperville – pharmacist
license (051-027896) placed on probation for one year due to a Department inspection which
revealed several violations of the Illinois Pharmacy Practice Act, which were repeat violations
from a past inspection, including the following: compounded medications were not labeled
properly, numerous compounding ingredients were found to be expired and Schedule III-V
controlled substance prescriptions were not signed by the pharmacist.

       Keil Pharmacy, Red Bud – pharmacy license (054-007097) reprimanded and fined
$2,500 as a result of controlled substance license having expired on March 31, 2008 but not
renewed until August 28, 2008.

                                              - 27 -
Illinois Department of Financial and
Professional Regulation
                                                                NEWS
   SPRINGFIELD - The Illinois Department of Financial and Professional Regulation (IDFPR)
   announced today that the Acting Directors of Professional Regulation, Donald W. Seasock; and
   the directors of Financial Institutions, Robert Meza; and Banking, Jorge A. Solis signed the
   following disciplinary orders in the month of April 2010.

                                      Division of Banking

                                     BANKS AND TRUSTS

          Brickyard Bank, Lincolnwood – consent order to stop engaging in unsafe and unsound
   banking practices.

          Broadway Bank, Chicago – Division of Banking took possession and control of bank on
   April 23, 2010 for the purpose of receivership.

          CIBM Bank, Champaign – consent order to stop engaging in unsafe and unsound
   banking practices.

          Citizens Bank & Trust Company of Chicago, Chicago – Division of Banking took
   possession and control of bank on April 23, 2010 for the purpose of receivership.

          New Century Bank, Chicago – Division of Banking took possession and control of bank
   on April 23, 2010 for the purpose of receivership.

          Norstates Bank, Waukegan – consent order to stop engaging in unsafe and unsound
   banking practices.

           Northside Community Bank, Gurnee – written agreement to improve the business
   practices of the bank.

          Peotone Bank and Trust Company, Peotone – Division of Banking took possession
   and control of bank on April 23, 2010 for the purpose of receivership.

         Valley Community Bank, St. Charles – consent order to stop engaging in unsafe and
   unsound banking practices.



                                                 1
       Wheatland Bank, Naperville – Division of Banking took possession and control of bank
on April 23, 2010 for the purpose of receivership.


                                         PAWNSHOPS


        Americash Jewelers Inc., Westmont – ordered to pay a $200 civil monetary penalty for
failing to file their 2009 Pawnshop Disclosure of Business Activities Report in a timely manner.

        B & B Pawn, DuQuoin – ordered to pay a $250 civil monetary penalty for failing to file
their 2009 Pawnshop Disclosure of Business Activities Report in a timely manner.

       Carol Stream Jewelry & Loan, Carol Stream – ordered to pay a $200 civil monetary
penalty for failing to file their 2009 Pawnshop Disclosure of Business Activities Report in a
timely manner.

        Lipa Enterprises Inc., Belgium – ordered to pay a $250 civil monetary penalty for
failing to file their 2009 Pawnshop Disclosure of Business Activities Report in a timely manner.

       Naperville Jewelry and Coin Exchange Inc., Naperville – ordered to pay a $250 civil
monetary penalty for failing to file their 2009 Pawnshop Disclosure of Business Activities
Report in a timely manner.

         Pawn Central, Rock Island – ordered to pay a $450 civil monetary penalty for failing to
file their 2009 Pawnshop Disclosure of Business Activities Report in a timely manner.

         Pontiac Pawn, Inc., Pontiac – ordered to pay a $200 civil monetary penalty for failing to
file their 2009 Pawnshop Disclosure of Business Activities Report in a timely manner.

         Prairie Street Pawn Shop, Galesburg – ordered to pay a $450 civil monetary penalty
for failing to file their 2009 Pawnshop Disclosure of Business Activities Report in a timely
manner.

        Premiere Pawn and Loan, Mattoon – ordered to pay a $600 civil monetary penalty for
failing to file their 2009 Pawnshop Disclosure of Business Activities Report in a timely manner.

         The Pawn Shop, Kankakee – ordered to pay a $100 civil monetary penalty for failing to
file their 2009 Pawnshop Disclosure of Business Activities Report in a timely manner.
